Posee  un taller y lavadero de motos instalada en una propiedad que adquirió hace como 5 años de un pariente y hace 2 años que monto su taller, un sobrino suyo esta como ayudante en el taller.  Cuenta con una clientela fija ya que sus servicios tiene  muy buena aceptación por los clientes.
Con este  préstamo de la Fundación Paraguaya podrá comprar los repuestos para motos y hacer frente a la numerosa demanda que tiene en su taller.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old, married, and has 2 sons. He has a motorcycle workshop and motorcycle washer set up on property that he acquired 5 years ago from a relative. He started up his workshop two years ago, and his nephew works there as his assistant. He has a regular clientele, since his services have been well-received by his customers. With this loan from the Fundación Paraguaya he will be able to buy spare parts for the motorcycles and meet the many demands of his customers in his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for motorcycles (covers, carburetors, accelerator cables, signal lights, etc.)

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en:
Terbish is 34 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. They have been living together in their current home for 20 years. Terbish operates a mobile dairy trading business in her town. She sells a variety of dairy products such as curds, milk and other products.

Terbish started her business in 2005 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 352 USD). After years of successful operations she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 3,000,000 tugrugs (~ 2111 USD) today. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a car which has proven useful in transporting her products and expanding her customer base. She is a very hardworking and open-minded person. Terbish is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~ 2111 USD) loan to increase her business's working capital.

loans.use: To increase her business's working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 35 years old and married with four children who are in school.    She runs a retail shop where she sells auto spare parts to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has one employee.   She was previously employed before she started this business.   She has joined a group of young entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya who are willing and determined to improve their lives. They meet on a weekly basis to save their money and later on the group guarantees its members a loan.  She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of spare parts.  She hopes to grow her business and stabilize her income in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of spare parts

loans.name: Indrani

texts.en:
Indrani is a 55-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, a town in the Matara area of southern Sri Lanka.  She has three sons and one daughter.  They are 25, 22, 19 and 17 years old.

Indrani manages a business of rice paddy cultivation with her husband. She has asked for a loan of 20,000 LKR from BRAC Sri Lanka for the development of her business.

She hopes to improve the cultivation and purchase materials. Also, she wants to provide nutritious options for her family through the increased income that she hopes to earn.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan.

loans.use: To buy materials for her rice paddy

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar de 25 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas, el vende sus mercaderías en un puesto del mercado municipal de Villarrica,  vende prendas de vestir  para damas,  caballeros y niños,  como blusas de licras, algodón, vestidos, jeans y otros. Actualmente llega la temporada fría por lo desea adquirir gran cantidad de ropas como camperas, sueter, pantalones y otros.
Desde muy joven se inicio a la venta de ropas, gracias a la ayuda de su madre a quien pertenecía dicho puesto de venta, anualmente el negocio esta a  cargo de Cesar,  y día a día va creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo.  

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de más mercaderías de la temporada para satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene
texts.en:
25-year old Cesar has his own business selling men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing from a stall in the municipal market of Villarrica. He sells lycra or cotton blouses, dresses, jeans and other clothing. Right now, as the cold season is approaching, he wants to stock up on jackets, sweaters, pants etc. Cesar has been selling clothing since he was a young man, helping his mother run this very same stall which used to belong to her. Gradually he took over the stall and it is doing very well thanks to his hard work. Cesar is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya to buy winter clothing for his many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cola nuts and rice

loans.name: Narcisa Aracely

texts.es:
Narcisa de 54 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (este lugar su originalidad fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil, ella tiene un puesto de venta de bebidas (colas, jugos, energizantes). 

Ella trabaja vendiendo bebidas al por menor y mayor, trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00am hasta las 15h00pm. No ha tenido oportunidad de arreglar su casa pero ahora con los ingresos que tiene de la venta de bebidas quiere mejorar su casa. Por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento arena y hierro. 

(En la foto aparece con una pared que esta construyendo), su meta es terminar de construir su casa y seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 54 years old. She lives in Las Orquídeas, an urban zone (it got its name because the countryside had lots of orchids) in Guayaquil. She has a stand where she sells drinks (colas, juices, and energy drinks). She works selling drinks for retail and wholesale. She works everyday from 8:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. She has not had the chance to fix up her house. But, now she wants to improve her house with the income she has from selling drinks. She wants to use the loan to buy cement, sand, and iron. (A wall that she is building appears in the photo.) Her goal is to finish building her house and to continue helping her family economically.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, sand, and iron

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, age 37, is the father of three children. He operates a "Bodaboda," which is a motorbike transport business. He is also a mixed agricultural and dairy farmer: he grows a tea crop as well as engaging in dairy farming. 

He joined the Kamburu Pamoja group in order to access financial resources from Faulu Kenya. In a group loan such as this, the members guarantee each other's loans. Michael has previously taken out a loan in the amount of Kes. 20,000, which he used to buy a dairy cow. This loan was successfully repaid. 

He is now requesting a loan in the amount of Kes. 50,000 in order to buy a Heifer. Michael hopes to open his own hardware shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy a Heifer

loans.name: Alinyikira Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
38 year old L. Sarah makes 100,000 shillings a week out of her poultry and eggs business in Kasangalabi-Mukono. She says most of her clients are retail buyers. She has been doing this for the last 8 years. With proper planning, proper feeding, and medication, she has ensured stability in her business. Her family of 4 has also been basking in this success. 

She also runs other side businesses: a commercial motorcycle business and a commercial farm. With these she is able to cut both ways in terms of alternating the usage of profits that come from each of her businesses.The proceeds from this loan she says are going to be used to buy more chicken feed and medications for increased output.

loans.use: purchase of chicken feed and medicine

loans.name: Peter Gikonyo

texts.en:
Peter has been in farming in Naivasha town since 2008.  He is 27 years old, married to Dorcas Nyambura and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of Kshs 22,000 well and on time.  He plans to use the cash from this loan to buy pesticides to spray the crops. 

Peter plans to buy his own lorry, which he will be using to transport his harvest to the market place.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to spray the crops.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a wife of M. A. and resides in a city called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is a city famous for dairy business.  
Her husband runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. He has been in this business for over three years. Earlier, his shop was the only shop who dealt with groceries, but now he is facing two more grocery shops in front of him, which can affect his selling. That’s why Razia has applied for a loan from Asasah, so her husband put the groceries in his shop and able to fulfill the demands of his customers on their asking. 

Razia owns a small house of two rooms and is living in it with her family. She is a caring lady and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife effectively. She is hopeful that this investment will bring the positive change to her husband’s business and he will be able to better manage the clientele base.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana V. is from the village of Kibatang, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 62 years old. Juana is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Juana owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Juana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Juana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with two children of whom one attends school while the other one is six months old and so is too young for school. Her husband is a teacher, contributing his earnings to the family’s other source of income. Jane lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water, citing her greatest monthly expense as food.

Jane has been running a school for the last five years, children from the neighboring community being her potential customers. She pointed out transportation and theft as major challenges in the business. She hopes to build two more streams in her school in the future.

Jane decided to join Yehu so as to obtain a loan to improve her business. With this Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to build her own house.

loans.use: To build  her own house

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
el señor Juan Bautista F. R. tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado, su esposa no trabaja y tiene dos hijos que dependen de el.
su esposa le ayuda con la pulperia cuando el no se encuentra en la casa y al cuidado de los niños, don Juan es una pèrsona muy humilde y respetuosa le gusta atender bien a sus clientes.
En su negocio el vende pan, manteca, jabon, churros, agua, refrescos, jabones, embutidos, harina de maiz, aceite, jabon de baño, pasta dental y muchas cosas mas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos, granos basicos, y abarroteria en general.
su mayor sueño es convertir su negocio en una pulperia grande y bien surtida en la cual pueda cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista F. R. is 48 years old, married, and has two children.  His wife does not work, so they all depend on him.  His wife helps him with his store when he isn't at home, and takes care of the children.  Juan is a humble and respectful person who likes to attend to his customers well.  

In his store, he sells bread, lard, soap, churros [fried dough], water, soda, sausages, corn flour, oil, bath soap, toothpaste, and many other things. 

He will use this loan to purchase drinks, basic grains, and other basic products.

His dream is to turn his business into a larger store that can meet all of the needs of his customers.

loans.use: Purchase of beans, sugar, rice, lard, oil, margerine, soup, sardines, coffee, bread, cookies, toothpaste, toilet paper, condiments, and pills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda A. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Wilfreda has a business buying and selling fish including sardines, milkfish, mackerel and salmon. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Wilfreda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fish to sell. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is transport costs.

He has been operating a barber shop for the past three years. In addition, he also runs a grocery business, selling retail, and at the market, which contributes to his other source of income. John faces the major challenges of seasonality and transportation in his business. He hopes to expand and sell cereals as wholesale in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase sacks of beans, maize, rice and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to get loans and improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, maize, rice and sugar

loans.name: Francisco Plácido

texts.es:
Francisco es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situado en la región Piura, esta región se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con un terreno heredado en donde suele sembrar mango y limón, como ya cuenta con varios años de experiencia en este negocio actualmente conoce bastante sobre el manejo de estos cultivos. Generalmente cosecha el limón durante todo el año y el mango una vez por año, las frutas las suele ofrecer en venta a las plantas procesadoras que se encuentran ubicadas en la carretera de acceso a su localidad. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Francisco desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de algunos fertilizantes de modo que pueda asegurarse una buena producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 43-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the rural part of the farming district of Tambogrande, located in the region of Piura. This region is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

He has a piece of inherited land where he tends to plant mango and lemon. Since he already has several years of experience in the business, he currently knows a great deal about caring for these crops. He generally harvests lemon during the entire year and mango once per year. He usually sells the fruits to the processing plants located on the highway leading to his area. He uses the money he earns from this business to help his family get ahead.

Francisco wants to expand his business with the purchase of fertilizers so that he can be sure of a good production. This is why he thought it would be good to request a loan for 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Expenses for maintaining his mango and lemon plants

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business and increase his monthly income

loans.name: Purity Wambui

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman of 20 years-old and the mother of one child. She stays at a place called Uthiru, Ndumbuini near the capital city. This is a middle class center and it has a high population.

She owns a butcher shop where she sells beef to the residents of Uthiru area. This is her primary business which she has been doing for the last two years.

She got to know about Kiva partner KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions.

With this loan, she plans to buy Kshs 40,000 of additional  beef so that she can better meet her client needs.

loans.use: To buy more beef.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun N. is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a teacher, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 10 on the children’s education, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. N. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su primer ciclo actualmente.
El grupo "Creciendo Juntas" es muy responsable, todas las integrantes tienen actividades diferentes para poder mantener a sus respectivas familias.
La Sra. Liliana A. se dedica a la venta de ropas y también elabora productos de limpieza, que luego sus hijos mayores venden a las personas y vecinos del barrio.
Todas las integrantes del comité han podido progresar sólo con la ayuda económica de la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, por eso agradecen inmensamente su colaboración.
texts.en: This communal bank is in their first loan cycle.  The group "Creciendo Juntas" [Growing Together] is very responsible.  All the members pursue different activities to support their families.  Señora Liliana A. sells clothing for a living.   She also makes cleaning products that her older children then sell in their neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase t-shirts, shorts, blouses, pants, skirts and towels to sell.  Also, raw materials such as beef, chicken, eggs, corn, cassava, etc. for empanadas.  Cleaning products such as detergent, shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta D. is from the village of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 60 years old. Restituta is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Restituta owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers like adobo & afritada in the local community. Restituta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Restituta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Restituta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Restituta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients like meat & vegetables & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Restituta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat & vegetables & to provide working capital

location.town: Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fifamé

texts.en:
Fifamé is 35 years old and lives in the Sèmè-Podji district of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She shares her home with her husband Dieudonné and their three children, who have all been educated. For the last 15 years, Fifamé has sold containers and miscellaneous items as a travelling salesperson. She sources these from Tokpa, the country's largest market.

This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful repayments, and Fifamé hopes to purchase more stock for her business. Her goal is to strengthen and grow her business.

loans.use: New stock of plastic containers

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is 34 years old, married and blessed with a two-year-old child.  He runs Softmax Computer Centre so as to earn a living.  He has been in the business for seven years.  He started the business after finishing his college studies.  He hopes to open a computer training school in the future.  He also dreams of opening other outlets for his business.  He has requested 80,000 KES to buy a video camera and repair some computers.

loans.use: To buy a video camera and repair some computers.

loans.name: Sroem

texts.en: Mrs. Sroem was born in 1943. She is a widow who lives with five other members of her household. She is a rice cake seller who is able to earn some profit to support her family. In addition to this business she is also a chicken breeder. Currently, she has a problem because her house does not have a well to use. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Sroem is applying for a loan to dig a well. With the rest of the loan she is going to buy more rice cakes for resale.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Shally

texts.en:
Shally D. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Shally is married and with two school-aged children. Shally sells religious items such incense and candles to tourists and local community members. Shally has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Shally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional religious items for resale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the sales to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional religious items like candles and flowers for retail sale

loans.name: José  Isaac

texts.es:
José tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y  reside junto familia en el sector Cercado Villa de Sol del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

José se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería, esta actividad la realiza hace 6 años, por ello conoce a la perfección este rubro y debido a su buen trabajo lo recomiendan sus clientes han hecho que su negocio se haga conocido y que cuente con una clientela fija.

José desea realizar mejoras en su vivienda y solventar gastos personales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old, is married, and lives with his family in the Cercado Villa de Sol sector of José Leonardo Ortiz District. This is one of the most populated districts of the Lambayeque region and is characterized by high poverty levels since the people generally live in underdeveloped urban areas that lack basic services.

José works as a bricklayer. He has been doing this for six years, so he knows the field perfectly. Because of his good work, his customers recommend him, which has made his business well-known, and he has steady customers.

José wants to make improvements to his home and cover personal expenses. Because of this, he decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles, which will help him to reach his goal.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house

loans.name: Esher

texts.en:
Esther A. is a 53-year-old widow who supports two children and one grandchild.  She is from the Gamalenga area in Vihiga.

Esther is applying for her first loan from Kiva field partner Kadet Ltd after being introduced to Kadet by a friend who is already a client.  Esther intends to use her loan money to buy more cowpea seeds to plant, and she will use any additional profits she makes at harvest time to pay for her dependents' school fees.

loans.use: to buy cowpea seeds to plant

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married and has two grown children. She lives in Novaya Kahovka. Nadezhda sells clothing at one of the local market places in her home town. She has been in this business for 16 years. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 21,500 Grivnyas, and her net profit is 6,000 Grivnyas a month. Nadezhda has 40,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase a new assortment of summer inventory: shorts, T-shirts, swimming suits, hats, etc.  She is an experienced entrepreneur who understands market demand and uses her knowledge to attract more customers. Nadezhda says her business is the main source of income for her family, which is why she works hard to keep it running efficiently and bring in a stable income.

loans.use: stock an assortment of summer clothes to sell

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 34 years of age and married with two children. Veronika owns & operates a business venture, which is running a taxi to take people along in Samoa.  She has many years of experience in this business. Veronika needs a loan of WST $1450 to renew her vehicle license.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Veronika joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Veronika's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to renew vehicle license

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a widow with one child in school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

For the past nine years, Harriet has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a well-furnished beauty salon.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to furnish her house and to purchase six windows, three doors, cement, and sand. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To furnish her house and to purchase six windows, three doors, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old with eight adult children. She has a manufacturing business where she makes and sells a variety of furniture like sala (patio) sets, dining tables and chairs. Susan is a beginner in this business because she has been doing it for only one year. She earns PHP 4,000 per month doing this type of work.

Susan is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy wood, paintbrushes and varnish to make more furniture to sell.

In the future, Susan hopes that her business will expand to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy wood, paintbrushes and varnish to make more furniture

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a hardworking 41 year old business man. He is married and blessed with three children.  For the  last three years he has been distributing water. He gets extra income from his rental houses.  In the next 5 years Evans wants to have opened up another water point and his dream is to expand his business beyond the region he is operating in now.
Evans is requesting  a loan of 10000 Kenya shillings to buy water pipes, cement and sand. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for advancing him finances to inject into his business.

loans.use: to buy water pipes, cement and sand

loans.name: Benkola 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKOLA 3 sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, YEH,  au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola 3 Group are married women who, on average, are 41 years old and have three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Yeh, sitting in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmelina es socia del banco comunal Family, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se de clima frió, es la tercera ciudad de más importante del país, en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad gracias a su belleza arquitectónica, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y cordial como nuestra socia.

Doña Carmelina tiene 44 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 24, 22 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados e independientes y su ultima hija está estudiando en el colegio.  No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica al cuidado de niños que son de sus amigas y conocidas, esta actividad la realiza hace 6 meses y trabaja de lunes a viernes.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de repuestos autumotríces para su vehículo. 

Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en: Carmelina is a member of the communal bank "Family."  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is a city with a cold climate.  It is the third largest city in the country.  In December of 1999 it was named as a UNESCO World Heritage site of outstanding cultural importance to the heritage of humanity, thanks to its architectural beauty.  The city also has a great variety in its cuisine, and cordial and friendly people like our member Carmelina.  She is 44 years old and is divorced.  From her marriage she has 3 children aged 24, 22 and 12.  Her oldest children are married and independent, and her youngest is in school.  She does not have her own house, so they live in a rented dwelling.  Carmelina provides day care for children of her friends and acquaintances.  She has been doing this activity for 6 months, and she works Monday through Friday.  In her communal bank she is in her 4th loan cycle, and she will invest the proceeds of this loan in spare parts for her automobile.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her automobile

loans.name: Dusabimana Group

texts.fr:
Imelde  est une commerçante  âgée de 32 ans . Elle habite  la localité de Gihamagara en province de Gitega.  Elle vend les produits alimentaires de boutique comme la farine de manioc,le haricot,le riz,les biscuits... depuis 8 ans.Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait les études jusqu’en 6e année primaire.Elle est mariée  à Gerard qui fait lui aussi le commerce de produits de boutique.Ils ont ensemble 3 enfants  dont  1 étudie a l’école primaire.
 Le crédit de Kiva de 200000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter beaucoup  de  produits  alimentaires de boutique(farine de manioc,haricot,riz,biscuits,etc) à revendre pour réaliser  de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “DUSABIMANA”
texts.en:
Melde is a merchant, 32 years old, who lives in the town of Gihamagara in the province of Gitega. She has been selling grocery items, such as cassava flour, beans, rice, cookies... for eight years. She is also a farmer. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is married to Gerard, who is also a grocer. Together, they have three children, of whom one is in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 200,000 Fbu is going to enable Melde to increase her capital in order to buy a lot of grocery items (cassava flour, beans, rice, cookies, etc.) to resell in order to make a large profit.

Melde is a member of the community group "DUSABIMANA"

loans.use: to increase capital in order to buy a lot of grocery items (cassava flour, beans, rice, cookies, etc.) to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera tiene dos hijos  vive con los hijos,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

maria se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano . Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes . El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. Enfreta desafios como la edad y la salud. Su sueño es tener casa propia para vivier con los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta limpiar la casa y conversar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is 49 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her two children in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.
She is a member of the El Placer village bank in Chillanes, in the town of San Jose del Tambo. It is an hour from the main office and has 24 members who work in agriculture, either growing bananas, rice, yucca, cacao, soybeans, and oranges or raising barnyard animals.
Maria grows rice, corn, oranges, soybeans, and bananas. She makes her purchases in San Jose del Tambo and then sells them in the Chillanes market on Sundays.
She is requesting this loan so she can buy farming supplies and fertilizers. It will help her improve her harvest. She is facing challenges like age and poor health. Her dream is to have her own house where she can live with her children.
In her free time, she likes to do housekeeping and talk to her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Edilburga

texts.es:
Edilburga es socia del Banco Comunal “Medallitas de Oro II”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Estudió solo hasta la primaria.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente ingresa al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ganados vacunos, ovinos y porcinos.  Con éste dinero comprará tres ovejas, la señora cuenta que los animales los compra de Totorani y Tiquillaca, y los  vende al instante aunque a veces los engorda por dos- tres meses.
En el negocio le ayuda su hermana, su esposo trabaja en la mina.
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar servicio de transporte y mejorar el negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Edilburga is a member of the “Medallitas de Oro II” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  She only completed her primary education.

Edilburga is a new member who recently joined Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She is requesting a loan for 500 soles to increase her business capital.  Her business is selling cows, sheep and pigs.  She will use this money to buy three sheep.  She tells us that she buys her animals in Totorani and Tiquillaca and sells them right away, though sometimes she fattens them for two or three months.  Her sister helps her in the business.  Her husband works down the mine.

Edilburga's dream is to own a car so that she can provide a transport service and improve her business.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy three sheep

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a single woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a business selling second hand clothes for the past five years. In addition, she sells sodas and ice water, which contributes to her other source of income. Her potential customers are the community members. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of second hand clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to save money and upgrade her business through taking a loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Sanluke

texts.en: Sanluke is a 25-year-old single woman with no children. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. She requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more charcoal for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Azraa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 28 years old, married, and a mother of two children.

Azraa has been a tailor since 2009, making, repairing, or altering clothing professionally as suits, coats and trousers for women. She has a sufficient experience in this field , a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is being well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for an $1800 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine, an embroidery machine, and a generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine, an embroidery machine, and a generator.

loans.name: María Carmita

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive por la comunidad de Racar en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la artesanía como es la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. María tiene 38 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 16, 9 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a laborar en diferentes actividades, labrando tierras ajenas o lavando ropa ajena.
 
En el banco comunal es socia hace un año y su crédito lo va a invertir en pollos y alimento para los mismos para iniciar con el negocio de cría de pollos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Futuro para un Bienestar" communal bank. She lives in the community of Racar near Cuenca, a place where one can admire beautiful scenery. People make their living in crafts, such as making bricks and roof tiles. Many work in the city in various livelihoods, while maintaining the culture and traditions of their forefathers.  

María is 38, married, and has three children ages 16, 9 and 4.  Her eldest daughter is in high school, and her second child goes to a small local school. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. She doesn't have her own house, so she rents.

She works at various activities, working other people's land, or doing their laundry. She has been in the communal bank for a year, and she is going to use her loan to buy chickens and chicken feed, and start a chicken-raising business. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for her business. In the future, Raya aspires to continue expanding her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Raya has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed for her business.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 36 years of age and is a farmer in the village. He has four children and he provides for their needs. To meet their demands, he is working hard in his business to yield enough profit. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase needed farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. 

He is working hard for the improvement of his family’s lifestyle as well as to secure the future of his children.

loans.use: to purchase needed farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, and  pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Dolibe

texts.es:
La señora dolibe , es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres Galácticas”. Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, a su cargo solo tiene a una de sus hijas que está estudiando.
Es una de las fundadoras de este banco comunal, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos comestibles y también bebidas gaseosas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.  2,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 3 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 caja de leche grande, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de sopas instantáneas, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 4 paquetes de gaseosas.
Su negocio está en su misma casa y su hija le ayuda en la atención, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, es el encargado de mantener el hogar, los ingresos que genera el pequeño negocio es para ir comprando más productos hasta que tenga lo necesario para dar buena atención.
texts.en:
Dolibe is a member of Mujeres Galácticas Communal Bank in the Coronel Portillo district of the department of Ucayali.  She's 60 years old and married, with three children.  She's responsible for only one of them, a daughter who's a student.

She's one of the founders of this communal bank.  She has a small business selling food products and also sodas.

With her new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] she will buy three packages of toilet paper, one large box of milk, one box of oil, one box of instant soup, one bag of sugar, one bag of rice, and four packages of soda.

Her business is in her house and her daughter helps her wait on customers.  Her husband is an employee in a company; he's responsible for supporting the household.  The income she generates in her small business is to buy more products until she has what's necessary to give good service.

loans.use: to purchase toilet paper, milk, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 45 years old she lives with her husband with whom she has four children. Vilma and her husband farm and raise pigs together. Since they moved in together and decided to have children they agreed that they would each work in their own businesses.

Vilma needs this loan to buy pigs and feed to fatten them up. That way, in a couple of months, she will have more income to cover her family's daily needs.

Vilma's dream it to keep increasing her income and give her children what they need.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feeds

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
My name is Saturnina G. and I have been selling corn tamalitos in my store for the past two years. This activity allows me to support my family. My customers are very nice because my store is located in part of the national market. My goal is to increase my sales in order to provide better education for my granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Saturnina G. me dedico a la venta de tamalitos de Elotes y Elotes Locos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, actividad que me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mis clientes son muy buenos porque estoy ubicada en un local del mercado nacional, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas para darle un mejor estudio a mi nieta.

loans.use: Buy corn, butter, cheese, margarine, water, salt

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: My name is Gloria, and, in Honduras, atol (a cornflour drink) and elote (corn) tamales are typical foods. Our entire town eats the corn products we make, and the tourists like the delicious flavors of Choluteca’s streets and boulevards. This income has allowed me to help my children through school and help with the household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, sugar, flour, water, firewood, cinnamon, milk.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S., who is 34 years old mother of 5 children, lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She makes around $2.5/day by growing a variety of crops in the field. Her husband is a construction foreman and generates about $4/day, which is a potential for their household. S. hopes the loan will help her in investing more seeds to grow and another part is to repair their house in order to protect it from leaking during the rainy season. In the future, Samnang would like to own a grocery store at the market.

loans.use: To purchase some seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair their house

loans.name: Maritza Pichardo

texts.en: Maritza, 45, runs a colmado (a typical Dominican grocery store) with her husband.  They have 8 children, and only the youngest (a boy of 19 years old), lives with them; the others are either with a partner or working in other townships.  None of her children have attended school, and Maritza herself had no formal education.  Her husband is jobless and helps her with the business.  Maritza wants to purchase larger quantities of goods like rice, oil, sugar, salt and so on, that can last for a long time.  This way, she won’t have to go to the capital every weekend to get the goods to sell.   For this reason, and also to set aside some money for her family’s needs, she is requesting a loan of US $375.00 that she’ll repay in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and put aside some money for family needs.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a 25 year old mother from the village of Safaatoa Tai. She has 2 kids who are not in school.  She runs a business selling popcorn and ice cream cake to make money for herself and her family.  She delivers to the village people and the primary school in her village. She has a hard working husband who runs a plantation business to support their family.  She earned $150 a week from the popcorn and ice cream cake and $200 from their taro banana and yam plantation.  She would like to borrow $850 from SPBD which is her 6th loan to expand her business and renovate her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her popcorn and ice-cake business

loans.name: Okhuelegbe

texts.en: D. is 38 years old and lives in Uromi, Edo state of Nigeria. For the past fifteen years he has been earning income as a carpenter. He has been a LAPO member for three years and now needs a loan of US$875 to buy wood and other materials for making furniture in his store.

loans.use: Purchase of wood and other materials needed for carpentry

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Married and a mother of 4 children, Mrs Jeanne E. is 33 years old and has been selling loincloths at the large market of Kpalimé for 10 years. Since her husband lost his job more than 10 months ago, she has been providing for most of her family's needs and is able to send her children to school. Mrs Jeanne would like to buy many more loincloths with this loan to grow her trade, satisfy the requests of her customers and to benefit her family and its survival.

Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, madame Jeanne E. est âgée de 33 ans et est revendeuse de pagnes au grand marché de Kpalimé depuis 10 ans. Elle subvient presque à toutes les dépenses du foyer et les charges scolaires de ses enfants grâce aux revenus provenant de son activité étant donner que son mari a perdu son emploi de puis plus de 10 mois. Madame Jeanne veut, par ces fonds acheter beaucoup plus de pagnes pour élargir la taille de son commerce, satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et dégager plus de bénéfices pour la survie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 balls of loincloth for resale

loans.name: Rosmi

texts.en: Rosmi, 39, is married to Z., who works as a landless farmer, and does not have a regular income. They have a son, who has already married. Rosmi has a grocery store at her house where she sells food, groceries, flavoured ice, cigarrettes, etc., and can earn up to $20 a day depending on the number of customers. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $100 to buy more goods for her store. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Amanecer De La Mujer Group

texts.en:
“Amanecer D. L. mujer” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with educational services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations, being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 6,000 – 17,000 ft above sea level). People there also face the cold, the difficulty growing crops, and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Amanecer D. L. mujer”, whose name can be translated as the “Awakening of the Woman”, is located in the community of AntacalL. in the district of Anco, province of Churcampa. The main activities of the population are growing corn (lower altitudes), potatoes and wheat (higher altitudes); raising guinea-pigs, pigs, and chicken, and they also have cows and bulls. The community of AntacalL. faces many difficulties due to its remoteness, lack of public transportation and access to markets. It receives very little in the way of public and social services.

The bank has just completed half a year of existence and its first loan-cycle, with currently 11 female borrowers and a total loan of 3,600 soles (about US$ 1,240). The loans range from 100, 200, 400 soles, up to 600 soles. Besides repaying their loans, the group was able to save over 1,500 soles (about US$ 520) during the first loan-cycle, and they will continue to put asiD. savings in the future.

During their first loan cycle, most members have learned how to do business. Whereas before most of their production was for home consumption, more and more they have learned to be entrepreneurs, to earn a little money with the work they do. And, sometimes for the first time in their lives, they have learned how to improve the quality of their lives and the importance of saving.

One of the members of the community bank is Saturnina Durán Chacasan. Saturnina buys and sells "tuna", the fruit of the tuna-cactus. Besides buying the fruit down at the Mantaro river-basin, she grows her own tuna in a small field of tuna-cactuses. She sells her tunas in one of the major cities in the central Peruvian Andes, Huancayo, more than 5 hours away from AntacalL.--at least, when she is lucky enough to find transportation. Her new loan of 500 soles, she will not invest in her tuna-business, however. This time she will buy a cow! Starting a new business! Although the cow will cost her 1,000 soles, she will put in the other half of the price of the cow herself, from her savings. One of the things she learned in FINCA Peru is not to talk badly of other people.

Another story is that of Florentina M. Durán, who has her business of baking and selling bread. Like all women in the community bank, she also has her fields with corn and wheat. Most of the production is for home consumption, but fortunately she also is able to sell some of her product. She will invest her 200 soles loan to buy more wheat for her bakery.

Rosa Ana S. D. L. C., who has requested a 400 soles loan, has a small business selling shoes, and Sundays when AntacalL. has its weekly market, she also sells meals. She will invest her loan in buying new shoes for her business. It's a good time for that, because schools are about to start again, and most children need new shoes to go with their school uniforms. And, like most members of her group, her dream is for her family to improve their quality of life and for her four children to study. She will use her savings for buying school necessities because a new school year is starting.

loans.use: expanding their small businesses or starting up new ones

loans.name: Kulwa's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Kulwa M. is 58 years old, married and has two children, ages 21 and 19. He runs a furniture store which he opened six years ago. He works from 7:30 a.m to 6 p.m. daily, and makes a profit of about $424 a month.

In the past, Kulwa has taken out four loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase the stock of furniture he has to sell. He has applied for a new loan for the same purpose. Kulwa will share this loan with the members of his group, who sell items such as fruit and vegetables, and services such as carpentry, butchery and grooming.

In the photo, Kulwa is second from the left in the back row, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: To help several small businesses expand

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs Lorn C. (pictured with her daughter and grandchildren) is a widow with five children, four sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live in the family home. The family lives across the Mekong River about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Lorn has been in the business of selling fruits and dessert in front of the village school for 18 years. Her daughter has been a weaver for seven years. It’s a skill she learned from her sister-in-law. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mrs Lorn is requesting a loan of US$150 to purchase silk material for her daughter's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson M. is a 36 year-old trained clinical officer. He is the proprietor of Makutano Medical Clinic based in the Meru Eastern part of Kenya. He offers various health services, such as family planning and maternal and child health, and also runs a pharmacy and a laboratory.

Jackson attributes his success to hard work, perseverance, and financial assistance from K-MET/KIVA. He requires $1200.00 to enable him integrate other services into his facility.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To integrate other services into his medical clinic.

loans.name: Talaitupu

texts.en:
Talaitupu L., 38, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the crab fishing business. She sells to the village community and relatives and also at the fish market when they catch a lot, 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Talaitupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also support her kids at school and make her church contribution. Her husband is always engaged in operating the business.

loans.use: replace all tools for her project of fishing crabs, coco wire, new canoe, etc.

loans.name: Rodolfa

texts.es:
Rodolfa lives with her husband and 2 children ages 7 and 4. Sewing has always been a source of income for Rodolfa to support her family, besides, it has been her favorite activity since she was a young girl.

She makes pants, sweaters, hats and gloves to sell them in the Sunday market. She makes them at home, which allows her to work all day. She has been doing this for eight years. Sewing has always been easy and fun for her, the problem is getting material of good quality and at good prices to make the clothing.

Rodolfa works hard for a better future for her family. With the loan Rodolfa will buy material and if possible a sewing machine to produce much more, in the future with the profits earned, she would like to own a general store and have it located in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Rodolfa vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 4 años. El tejer siempre ha significado para Rodolfa una fuente de ingresos económicos para mantener a su familia, además de su actividad favorita desde que era niña.

Ella elabora pantaloncitos, chompas, chullos, gorritos y guantes para venderlos en la feria dominical, elaborándolas en su casa, lo que le permite trabajar todo el día, desde hace ya ocho años atrás. Tejer siempre se le ha hecho fácil y agradable, lo problemático es poder conseguir material de buen precio y calidad para elaborar sus prendas.

Rodolfa trabaja incansablemente por un mejor futuro para su familia. Con el préstamo Rodolfa piensa comprar material y si es posible una máquina de tejer para producir mucho más, en un futuro con el dinero ganado le gustaría poner una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and material to make beautiful clothing.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Fatoumata D. N° 2 est âgée de 36 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec un enfant dans le quartier attbougou un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Pour des raisons sociales elle abandonna prématurément l’école. Après s’être s’essayé à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès, elle finit par apprendre auprès de sa grande mère le secret de la fabrication de l’encens (déodorant traditionnel). Après sa phase d’apprentissage, depuis maintenant 10 ans, elle exerce cette activité et jouit aujourd’hui d’une notoriété d’envergure sous régionale. Elle reçoit des commandes de toute la sous région de l’Afrique de l’ouest (Burkina Faso et Côte d’ivoire). Pour avoir de l’encens de qualité (c’est-à-dire avoir une bonne odeur), il faut du magnonkisèni (plante exotique très prisée en Afrique de l’ouest) assaisonné à des parfums et à l’eau de Cologne pendant un mois.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans.
Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt : 30Kg de graine d’encens (magnonkisèni), 70Kg de Kèni (encens naturel), 15 cartons de parfums (y compris l’eau de Cologne) et des bouteilles vides. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières essentiellement au grand marché de la ville de Ségou et vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes du Mali et des pays voisins. Elle est sollicitée lors des mariages car sa marchandise est très prisée par les nouveaux mariés.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter le fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de se construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata D. I. is 36 years old and lives in a monogamous family with one child in the area of Attbougou, one of the outlying areas of the city of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). For social reasons, she left school early. After attempting many profit-generating businesses without success, her grandmother taught her the secret art of incense (traditional deodorant) production. She finished her apprenticeship and for the last 10 years has practiced this business. Today, she enjoys the benefits of a good reputation on a regional scale. She receives orders from all over the sub-region of West Africa (Burkina Faso, Côte d'Ivoire). To make a good quality incense with a pleasant smell requires magnonkisèni, an exotic plant highly valued in West Africa, to be seasoned with perfumes and eau de Cologne for one month. To satisfy her growing clientele, she decided two years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. After four joint group loans all which were properly repaid, she has requested her first individual loan. With this loan she plans to purchase 30 kg of incense seed (magnonkisèni), 70 kg of Kèni (natural incense), 15 boxes of perfume (including eau de Cologne) and empty bottles. She gets her supplies mostly from the large market in the city of Ségou and sells her product for cash or on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women and men from Mali and neighboring countries. When weddings take place she is in very high demand due to the fact that her product is highly valued by newlyweds. She plans to earn a monthly income of 50,000 FCFA which will be used mainly to increase her business capital. Her dream is to build a new home.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materiels for incense production

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama T., 48, is married with 7 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Miriama's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to repair her house. She does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase weedkiller, gromozone, pesticide, bricks, cement, timber etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Noy La Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Noy L., 25 years old and the mother of a two-year-old child, is the group leader of five who all live in Slab Ta Aon Village in Kandal Province. Noy is a vegetable seller in the local village, and since this business is going well, she is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of vegetables to meet customer demand. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver making a small income that helps to support the family.

One member of this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Militza

texts.en: Militza is a member of the Gratitud Village Bank. She is 34 years old and married with one son. She and her husband have a timber-selling business called “Sergio.” Militza sells sticks, beams and mainstays to different companies (e.g. mines). She buys the lumber from different local communities. Militza needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy more lumber. Militza’s dreams are to expand her business, to send her son to a good college, and to have a comfortable home. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Militza es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud. Militza es casada, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Militza junto a su esposo tiene una maderera llamada Sergio, Militza vende palos, postes, puntales a las diferentes empresas como minas, sus productos los adquiere en las diferentes comunidades de la región. Militza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera. Los sueños de Militza son ampliar sus negocios, su hijo estudie en una buena universidad y tener una casa con todas las comodidades.

loans.use: Buy lumber

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Vĩnh năm nay 49 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng  2 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện tại  công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi lợn và trồng trọt với thu nhập  2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 6.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Vĩnh, 49 years old, lives with her two children in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. Presently, the main sources of income for her family are raising pigs and growing crops. Their income is about 2,000,000 VND (125 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 6,000,000 VND (375 USD) to invest in buying more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Deyana Group

texts.en:
Deyana is the leader of the Deyana loan group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a part of the loan for expand their business. 

Najeya and Deyana want to use the loan for their carpet weaving business to buy a new machine, and Faryda wants to use the loan to open a shop for her beading business. They also want to stock necessary materials for their businesses. 

That want  to say that they appreciate these new loans that help strengthen their businesses and to thank Kiva for its support of small business in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials to operate and expand their businesses.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre de 55 años, vive solo en un cuarto alquilado, no tiene hijos, pero compensa esa falta dándoles mucho amor a sus dos pequeños sobrinos, los cuales son una alegría para él. Endulzando la vida de sus clientes con sus ricas golosinas, Juan pasa sus días sentado en una vieja banquita, pues tiene un pequeño puesto en un parque concurrido de la ciudad de Juliaca, a él le gusta bromear con sus clientes, es muy amable y divertido y desea tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender sin miedo a que llegue la lluvia, ya que la temporada de lluvia es la más difícil para Juan, ya que no vende mucho. Son 6 años los que lleva en este negocio y  siente que ya es hora de crecer, Juan siempre saca unos dulces de su puesto, para dárselos a sus tiernos sobrinos, los cuales lo quieren como un padre. Es el primer préstamo al que Juan accede y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con el dinero solicitado pretende comprar más mercadería, invertirá todo en ello, ya que quiere que su negocio progrese.
texts.en:
Juan is a 55 year old man and lives by himself in a rented apartment. He does not have any children of his own but compensates for this absence by giving lots of love to his two young nephews, who are a source of joy for him. He sweetens the lives of his clients with his delicious sweets. Juan spends his days sitting on an old bench at his small stand in a busy park in the city of Juliaca. He enjoys joking with his clients and is very friendly and fun. He would like to have a sweets store where he can sell his sweets without fear of rain. The rainy season is the most difficult time for Juan as his sales are very low during this time. He has had his business for 6 years and feels that it is time to grow. He always takes some sweets from his stand to give to his beloved nephews, who love him like a father. This is the first loan that Juan has applied for and he is confident that he will be able to make the payments on time. He is one of the most active members of his community bank and is well loved and respected. With the money from the loan he will purchase more merchandise to help grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús es socio del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Jesús es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Jesús de acuerdo a la temporada y demanda vende diferentes productos como en época escolar vende mochilas, en carnavales talco, serpentinas. Sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Jesús necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de talcos y serpentinas.
Los sueños de Jesús son incrementar su capital, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the communal bank, "Las Gaviotas." Jesús has a live-in girlfriend, is 38, and has 3 children. In accordance with the seasons and demand, Jesús sells different products. During the school year, he sells backpacks. During carnivals, he sells talc and streamers. He gets his products from the city of Lima. Jesús needs a loan of 1000 soles, which he will invest in the purchase of talc and streamers. The dreams of Jesús are to increase his capital and to purchase a car to transport his products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase talc and streamers

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells cosmetics. She is a LAPO client. She is 32 years old and married with no children. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Duoc's Group

texts.en:
Được Nguyễn Thị was born in 1971. 010117050031. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Dai Bi village. She is a farmer and her husband is a builder. They have a monthly income of around VND 2,500,000 (about US $140). She is requesting VND 6,322,000 (about US $356) to have more capital to buy fish to resell in the market. She is the group leader.

Besides her there are 2 members in her group: 
Que H. T. was born in 1949, no. 010117050040, and is borrowing VND 4,142,000 over 12 months to buy goods to resell. 
Oanh N. T. K. was born in 1959, no. 010117050036, and is borrowing VND 5,014,000 over 12 months to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell in the market

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 55 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad has owned a restaurant since 2005. He requested a loan of $2000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his restaurant. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his business, as well as his financiA. situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mouhamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant merchandise

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores II ubicado en Jaillihuaya del  distrito de Chuchito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 42 años de edad,  2 hijos, de estado civil casada, posee estudios de segundaria completa. Vive en la Urbanización Ciudad Jardín, Maz-B2  Lte. 7.
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años e inicio su negocio de venta de artesanías, con un préstamo inicial de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles, compro lanas.
En el momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de Lanas de diferentes colores  para la elaboración de de sus artesanías y también comprara napa (relleno). Su mayor sueño es formar una micro empresa de venta de artesanías.
A ella le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, las charlas,  la puntualidad y la forma de pago.
texts.en:
Josefa is a member of the "Las Flores II" Communal Bank located in Jaillihuaya in the Chuchito district in Puno. She is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She has completed her secondary school studies. She lives in the Garden City Development. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years and started her business selling handicrafts. With the initial loan of 300 soles, she purchased wool. Currently she is seeking a loan of 600 soles to invest in the purchase of wools of different colors to create her handicrafts, as well as to purchase stuffing. Her dream is to form a microbusiness for handicraft sales. She enjoys the meetings at her Communal bank--the chats, the punctuality, and the form of payment.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different colored wool and stuffing

loans.name: Welburga

texts.en:
Welburga O. is from the town of Luyongbonbon Opol Misamis oriental. She is 49 years old. Welburga is separated from her spouse and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Welburga owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing slightly used "ukay-ukay" clothing to local community members. Welburga has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Welburga joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Welburga is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Welburga from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and save for future emergencies.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Mayda

texts.es:
Mayda es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Mayda es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Mayda viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende ropa variada, sus productos los comercializa de manera ambulatoria en diferentes ferias de la selva.
Mayda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de faldas, pantalones.
Los sueños de Mayda son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayda is a member of the Violeta Microfinance Institute.

Mayda is a 36-year-old married mother with 4 children. She travels to the Ayacucho jungle, where she sells assorted apparel. She sells her merchandise as a street vendor throughout the different markets of the jungle.

Mayda needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing skirts and pants.

She dreams of having her own house built and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase skirts and pants

loans.name: Samad

texts.en:
