Samad A. is forty-four years old and married with four children. He has been involved in the sale of spare parts for cars since 1999. Since then, his business has gradually expanded. Being hard-working and polite by nature, Samad has managed to develop a clientele that is happy with the goods and the service. The income he receives allows him to provide for his family's needs; he is the only bread-winner in the family.

Samad is requesting $2000 to purchase more spare parts for cars to increase his range of goods. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him. He promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for cars

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana  es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís 
Ana es casada tiene 32 años, tiene  un hijo D. 6 años que esta en la escuela estatal.
Ana estudio contabilidad en un instituto  pero no término, por que se le presento la oportunidad D. trabajar en ventas donD. aprendió D. ventas  se independizo por que tenía que cuidar a su hija. Ella actualmente se dedica alas ventas D. ropa y D. loceria.
DesD. que Ana esta en Finca, los prestamos  han sido D. ayuda para su desarrollo personal, ahora es independiente económicamente 
Ana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. mercadería y  loceria.
El sueño D. Ana es tener negocio propio, le gustaría poner un bazar.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the San Luís Community Bank. Ana is 32, married, and she has a six year old child who attends the state school. Ana studied accounting in school, but she did not finish. Instead, she had the opportunity to work in sales. She learned about sales, and she started on her own because she had to take care of her daughter. She currently sells clothing and pottery. Since Ana has been with Finca, the loans have helped her personal development. She is now economically independent. Ana needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy merchandise and pottery. Ana’s dream is to have her own business. She would like to set up a variety store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and pottery

loans.name: Betina

texts.en:
Betina is a member of the Emba kassy borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 45 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 18,14 and 10 years.

Betina started her own charcoal business 15 yeras ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 400,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Betina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh In order to buy more charcoal.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Betina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: Tobuy more charcoal

loans.name: Rosemary Chepkesis

texts.en:
Rosemary Chepkesis is 53 years old and married to Sammy N.Naibei.They are blessed with two children.Her clothing business is located in the Town Centre of Eldoret Town.

She has been in the Clothing business for the past two years now. Rosemary heard of KADET through an advertisement and with the loan, she intends to buy more clothing for her store including clothes,blankets and sweaters .In the future she intends to venture into other businesses.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy more stock which includes clothing for both adult and children.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience sells eggs in dozen and she also sells bags. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He want to completed his stocks

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia Justina; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 71 años de edad, ella es viuda, y tuene 5 hijos, todos sus hijos son actualmente independientes, ella tiene  una cantera de piedras en Rumicolque, desde hace 20 años. Está cantera les permitió vender lajas de piedras pulidas para la decoración de casas y hoteles en la zona, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en el alquiler de camiones para sacar las piedras.

La socia esta muy agradecida con el préstamo que se le otorgara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
La socia Justina; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene 71 años de edad, ella es viuda, y tuene 5 hijos, todos sus hijos son actualmente independientes, ella tiene una cantera de piedras en Rumicolque, desde hace 20 años. Está cantera les permitió vender lajas de piedras pulidas para la decoración de casas y hoteles en la zona, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en el La socia esta muy agradecida con el préstamo que se le otorgara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas en el plazo establecido. Justina is a member of 'LAS TRIUNFADORAS" communal bank which is located in the Andahuaylillas district which is 5 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 71 years old, a widow, and the mother of five independent children. She has had a rock quarry in Rumicolque for the last 20 years. This quarry allowed her to produce and sell polished stone tile used in decoration of area homes and hotels. She needs financing to She is grateful for the financing which will be granted and pledges here to repay her installments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease trucks to remove boulders.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
La señora Rogelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesionales a sus hijos, y teniendo su propio capital para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa, la cual lleva 05 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad y con su carácter emprendedor que siempre le ha caracterizado, decidió implementar su negocio de ventas de menú, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Rogelia, vende sus comidas a partir de las 11:30 am y nos cuenta que sus ventas diarias de abarrotes y comidas, le van muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para preparar sus alimentos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Rogelia, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir administrando y ejerciendo sus negocios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Rogelia is a member of the communal bank “Mariscalense”, located in the district of Juanjui, in the Mariscal Cáceres province, department of San Martín. She is 56 years old, married with two children (one of them still depends on her financially).
She hopes for her children to become professionals. Having the necessary income, she decided to establish her own grocery store inside her home. She’s had this business for five years. Her entrepreneurial spirit also led her to open a restaurant inside her home. The restaurant is well conditioned to serve her clients. Rogelia sells food starting at 11:30 am. She tells us that both her businesses (grocery store and restaurant) are going well.
With the loan of S/ 2,800.00 she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, boxed fish preserves in a variety of brands, eggs and personal hygiene products. She will use part of the money to buy ingredients and utensils for her cooking and be able to provide quality service to her clients.
Rogelia still feels strong to continue to manage and run her businesses. She is thankful to the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” (Kiva partner) for making her dreams and goals come true.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Srey Pao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Pao T. is the group leader of four members who all live in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns 4-hectare (10-acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

In this plantation, Mrs. Srey Pao T. faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She will use the rest of money to hire laborers to work on the rice field.

Mrs. Srey Pao T. is 33 years old and is a widow with two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA ELIZABETH F. G. D. Z., tiene  42 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria y  tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente D. ella. La socia se dedica a la crianza D. vacas, a la venta D.  leche y elaboración D. quesos, quesillos y yogurt.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró alimentos para las vacas e insumos para la elaboración D. yogurt.
Con este crédito D. 2,000 nuevos soles comprará 1 vaca y alimento para vacas.
Ella sueña con aumentar el número D. su ganado y así poder vender mayor cantidad D. leche .
texts.en:
Mrs. MARIA ELIZABETH F. G. D. Z. is 42 years old and lives in the Moche district in the Trujillo province in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the communal bank “Simpre Adelante II” (Always Ahead II). She has finished school through her 5th year of secondary and has 4 children who are economically dependent on her. She raises cattle, sells milk and makes cheese and yogurt. With her first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Solos she bought food for the cows and supplies to make yogurt. With this loan of 2000.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy 1 cow and food for the cows. Her dream is to increase the size of her herd and in this way she will be able to sell more milk.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one additional cow and fodder for the entire herd

loans.name: Jesus De Nazareth Group

texts.es:
CARMEN, ESTA CASADA, TIENE 44 AÑOS D. EDAD, Y TIENE 4 HIJOS ADULTOS. ACTUALMENTE ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO "JESUS D. NAZARETH",INTEGRADO POR 11 SOCIAS QUE RESIDEN EN LA ZONA D. SAN JUAN BAUTISTA EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
HACE CINCO AÑOS, LA SRA. CARMEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. ROPA EN BASE A PEDIDOS QUE LE SOLICITAN SUS FAMILIARES, AMIGOS Y CONOCIDOS. ELLA INICIÓ TRABJANDO PARA UNA EMPRESA, QUE DEJABA MERCADERÍA EN LOS MERCADOS Y ELLA SE DEDICABA A LA COBRANZA, ESTUVO TRABAJANDO PARA ESA EMPRESA UN TIEMPO HASTA QUE APRENDIÓ EL MANEJO DEL NEGOCIO Y SE INDEPENDIZÓ.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO TENER MAS MERCADERÍA PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES, Y LE PERMITE AHORRAR.
ELPRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN PEDIDOS PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVID.ÑA.
texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Currently she is the president of the group “Jesus D. Nazareth” which is maD. up of 11 members who live in the San Jaun Bautista zone in the Comas district. For the past 5 years, Carmen has sold clothing by order. The orders are solicited from family members, friends and acquaintances. She began working for a company who left merchandize in the markets and she collected the money. She worked for the company for a while until she learned how to manage a business and then she went out on her own. With her work she has been able to obtain more merchandise to offer her clients and allows them to save. The loan that she is soliciting will be used for Christmas orders.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for orders

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 20  años, y cuya familia esta integrada por su hijo de 2 años y sus padres, y del cual vive en casa de ellos. Hace un año que se dedica a la venta de animales menores, siendo este trabajo que le recomendó sus padres, desde entonces tiene su granja y del que se dedica ahora atendiendo a sus cuyes, dando su alimentación, procura cada cierto tiempo asear su galpón permitiendo la salubridad a sus animales y así como por su misma salud. Dentro de esta actividad también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, y credos. Es así como Betty cada temporada lleva sus animales a la feria ganadera para venderlos, comercio que le ha dado buenos dividendos cada dos semanas.  De esta manera el ritmo de negocio le ha ayudado obtener más animales para su comercialización. Por lo que espera más adelante contar con una extensa con una buena infraestructura. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que esta muy contenta por el apoyo que le han brindado, además ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos y se siente muy contenta de pertenecer a su grupo comunal. Con el préstamo que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más animales como cuyes, gallinas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Betty is 20 years old and lives with her son of two years and her parents in their house. At her parent’s encouragement, Betty started selling baby animals a year ago. She has since acquired a small holding where she looks after and feeds her guinea pigs, and, every now and then, tidies her storehouse, making sure everything is kept in a sanitary condition for both her and her animals’ wellbeing. Betty also raises common domesticated fowl and guinea fowl. Every season, Betty takes her animals to the cattle market to sell them, giving her a good income every two weeks. Working at a steady pace allows Betty to buy more animals. In the future, she plans to build on her business and develop a more solid infrastructure. This is Betty’s third loan with MFP, and she is very grateful for the help it provides. Betty is punctual with her repayments and is very pleased to belong to such a cooperative. Betty will use the loan to buy more animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 42 años, recientemente se casó con Percy, de 30 años, y por el momento viven en la casa de los padres de ella.
Desde hace 5 años decidió encargar se de las siembras de sus padres, porque ellos ya no podías hacerlo. Desde entonces empezó a sembrar arveja, papa, maíz y flores; paralelamente también cría ovejas y ganado vacuno. Afortunadamente, ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, y a ambos les apasiona sembrar flores porque disfrutan de su cultivo, cuidado y cosecha; además considera que sus actividades son rentables porque le ayudan a sostener a su familia y a ahorrar para más adelante poder comprar una casa, más terrenos agrícolas y poder sembrar en mayor cantidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y como la primera vez, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas para no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal, pues desea acceder a más créditos que le permiten salir a delante. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico, fertilizantes y una bolsa de semillas de arveja.
texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and recently married to Percy, who is 30. For the moment they are living in the home of Nora's parents. Five years ago Nora decided to take over charge of her parents agriculture business, because they were no longer able to manage. Since then, she began to grow potatoes, corn, flowers and other crops. In parallel, she also raises sheep and cows. Fortunately, she can now count on the help of her husband, and they are both passionate about cultivating flowers. They feel they have a viable business because it enables them to support their family, as well as save so that they can buy their own house, buy more land to farm and plant in greater quantities.

This is the second loan with MFP, and just like the first time, Nora has committed to make punctual payments to maintain her good standing with the communal bank. She would like to be able to secure more loans in the future. This loan will be used to purchase organic fertilizer as well as bags of more seeds to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of seeds to plant and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Evelyn Scarlet

texts.es: Evelin tiene 35 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de videos juegos. Tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años respectivamente los 2 estudian gracias al sacrificio que su madre realizar para brindarles los estudios necesarios. Sus clientes son niños que viven por su vecindario, otros son personas adultas que se divierten de la forma más sana, ella es una persona muy luchadora y conversa con cada uno de ellos, pues lo aconseja muy bien. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de discos, reparar un televisor que se le daño y además controles. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio mas y establecer una tienda de mercadería en general.
texts.en:
Evelino is 35 years old and her business is a video game arcade. She has two children aged 15 and 12 respectively, both of whom study thanks to the sacrifices their mother has made to provide for their studies. Her clients are children who live in her community and adults looking for a healthy diversion. She is a tough and hard-working woman, who chats with all her clients and gives them good advice. She is currently seeking this loan to buy new game CDs, repair a broken TV screen, and buy more controllers. Her dream is to further grow her business and start a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - new game CDs and controllers; repair a broken TV screen

loans.name: Gerrilyn

texts.en:
Gerrilyn J. is from the village of P1, Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Gerrilyn is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Gerrilyn owns & operates a specialized retail business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Gerrilyn has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gerrilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerrilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Gerrilyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gerrilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kasenge Women's Group, Mukono

texts.en:
At the top left of the photo of her lending group is N. Justine. She is a determined and hardworking lady aged 58 and a single mother with six children, some of them grown up, and grandchildren to take care of.

Justine is into the business of secondhand clothes and also has had a canteen in Mbalala, Mukono, for fifteen years. Although she has inadequate business capital, she is able to make some profits that have helped her in taking care of her family.

Justine ensures that she attends to her customers well and this will enable her to expand her businesses further. She has a goal of constructing a house for her family with her savings and she needs a loan to be able to restock her clothing and canteen businesses with more goods.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and produce to sell

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om S., age 46, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She stays at home as a housewife to look after the children and the household chores. Her husband is a construction middleman, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since her husband has had this business. S. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more construction supplies to expand her husband business.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to expand the business

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Guadalupe, un distrito de la zona costera perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en una combi que cubre la ruta que une las ciudades de Guadalupe, Chepén y Pueblo Nuevo. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos económicos los cuales utiliza en sus gastos personales y en el apoyo a la economía de su familia.

Cesar es consciente de que la vida de sus usuarios depende de la responsabilidad con la que realice su trabajo, por eso el desea mantener en regla todos los documentos que garanticen la seguridad de sus clientes, tal es el caso del SOAT que es un seguro que cubre el tratamiento de sus clientes ante un eventual accidente, el desea renovarlo este año y para ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Cesar es una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y brindarles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is single, 21 years old, and lives with his parents in the district of Guadalupe, a coastal district that pertains to the Pacasmayo province, in the region of La Libertad, about an hour and ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past year, he has been offering transportation services with his van to passengers traveling between the cities of Guadalupe, Chepen, and Pueblo Nuevo. This business is his only form of income, which he uses to cover his personal expenses and to help support his family. Cesar is aware that his passengers rely heavily on him and the responsibility of his work. As such, he hopes to keep all of the documents that guarantee the safety and the security of his clients in order. For example, the SOAT, which is an insurance that covers all medical treatments for his passengers in case of an accident. He hopes to renew it this year and that is why he is applying, for the first time, for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 soles that would be used towards this expense. Cesar is a very responsible and hard working individual. His main goal is to keep growing as a business man and to be able to offer his parents a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of insurance in order to offer public transportation services.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.es:
La señora Nicanora tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos que aún viven con ella. Posee una despensa en su domicilio ubicado en un conocido barrio de la ciudad de Itá, donde provee a sus clientes antiguos y a ocasionales de yerba, bebidas en general, carne, panificados, lácteos, carbón, azúcar, arroz y otras mercaderías hace más de 10 años.
La misma se inicio en el ámbito financiero gracias del pequeño préstamo que recibió por parte de la Fundación Paraguaya en cuyo cumplimiento demostró ser muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el tiempo la señora Nicanora logró aumentar su línea de crédito con la institución y gracias a eso hoy día posee una despensa bien surtida y una mayor clientela formada en su negocio.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mercaderías varias tales como: carnes, panificados, bebidas en gral., lácteos, etc.
texts.en:
Nicanora is 50 years old and married. She has 2 children who still live with her. She operates a food market in her home, which is located in a well-known neighborhood of the city of Itá. To both longstanding and occasional customers, she has sold yerba tea, beverages in general, meat, breads, dairy products, charcoal, sugar, rice and other merchandise for more than 10 years. She originally financed her business with a small loan she received from the Paraguaya Foundation, and she showed herself to be very responsible in making the payments for that loan. Over time, Nicanora has been able to expand her credit line with the institution, and thanks to this, today she has a well-stocked store and a solid customer base. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy a variety of merchandise, such as meat, breads, beverages, dairy products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying meat, beverages, dairy products, yerba tea, breads, and bulk products

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es: Nazario, de 52 años, es casado y tiene ocho hijos. Reside en una comunidad de la selva cusqueña, y en este lugar tiene su casa que es propia.Nazario recuerda que cuando era joven cometió ciertos  errores como agricultor, ya que vendía sus productos a precios inferiores , y solo le servía para subsistir, pero eso le sirvió de mucho para que aprenda a comparar los precios del mercado. Es por esta razón que en la actualidad atiende a grandes compradores a un  precio competitivo, y esta obteniendo buenos resultados económicos. Ya lleva 44 años dedicándose a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo del cacao, y en el futuro piensa ampliar su terreno de cultivo, con la finalidad de poder satisfacer a sus habituales clientes. Normalmente trabaja solo,pero en tiempo de siembra  y cosecha necesita de la ayuda de sus peones para que le agilicen la extracción de sus productos. Y luego los comercializa en su misma comunidad.Este es su tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, durante las fechas estipuladas; además agradece a su banco comunal por lo facilidades que le brinda, que les favorece para trabajar en equipo. Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de cacao a otros productores, con el propósito de atender la demanda de sus clientes y además mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nazario, 52, is married and has 8 children. He lives in a community in the Cusco backcountry where he owns his house. Nazario remembers that when he was young he made some mistakes as a farmer because he would sell his crops for too low a price and only earned enough income to subsist. However, this experience served him well because he learned how to buy at market prices. He currently has many large buyers that pay competitive prices and he’s getting good economic results. He has been a farmer for 44 years, specifically cocoa bean farming. In the future, he plans to expand his growing fields aiming at producing enough to meet all his regular customer demand. Normally he works alone but during planting and harvesting seasons he hires field hands to help ease the work load. He sells his crops in his own community. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion; he is also grateful to his communal bank for the easy payment plans it offers that allows them to work well as a team. He plans to use the funds to buy large amounts of cocoa beans from other producers so that he can have enough to meet customer demand and to improve his living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large amounts of cocoa beans to sell.

loans.name: Johana Antonia

texts.es: Johana Antonia tiene un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, realiza sus compras de contado y a camiones repartidores, sus ventas las efectúa de contado y al crédito. Por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. El crédito lo ofrece solo a clientes que ya tienen tiempo de trabajar con ella,  así aumentan sus números de clientes en su pulpería. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio y hacerlo más productivo. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y si es posible tener otro medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Johana runs a general store from her home. She buys her merchandise in cash from delivery trucks. Her sales are cash and credit. She has always struggled to improve her family’s quality of life. She offers credit to established customers, allowing her to increase her clientele. She is requesting this loan in order to invest into her business; to make it more productive. She would eventually like to expand her business and perhaps create a second source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Granada (Flat) Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo llamado Granada (Flat), porque donde ellas se ubican las calles tienen nombres de fruta y una de ellas es este. El grupo lo conforman cinco mujeres que son amas de casa y que además entre ellas existe una buena relación de amistad y siempre que alguna esta en problemas las demás acuden para ayudar. Las integrantes son; Ana Lucia Texiz Fernández (Gimnasio), Mónica O. A. (venta de colchas por catalogo), Ivonne V. Rodríguez (venta de pozole), Carmen R.
texts.en: Introducing the Granada (Pomegranate) group, whose name is inspired from the fact that where its members live streets are named after fruit. The group is composed of 5 women, all housewives, and who are also bound by a good friendship: when one of them has problems the others are always there to help out. The members are: Ana Lucia Texiz Fernández (gym), Mónica O. A. (sale of bedspreads from a catalogue line), Ivonne V. Rodríguez (sale of maize stew), Carmen R.

loans.use: To buy biodegradable plastic bags (garbage and kilo bags for individual products)

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer B. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling nipa leaves and water refills. She lives in Prk. Orchids, Brgy. Enclaro Vista Aligre, Ilog, Negros Occidental with her husband, Alex, a 39-year-old tricycle driver, and their four children who are between 3 months and 12 years old. Jeniffer has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard buying and selling nipa leaves and in her water refill business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Jeniffer is borrowing 27,000 PHP to use for her businesses. This will be her tenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Jeniffer hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Cattle are raised in order to be butchered, to obtain derived products, as well as to be used for agricultural tasks. Shavkat has been dedicated to cattle farming for 5 years. He started this business as a young man, with his father's support. He is presently the father of 4 children of all ages. He makes a great effort in order to meet the needs of the children in his charge and to bring sustenance to his humble home. His greatest need now is to buy young cattle for expanding his business. For this reason, Shavkat turned to IMON International, in order to obtain loans that will allow him to purchase these animals and make his business advance.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two grown children. She is a clothing merchandise vendor in the central marketplace of her home town of Novomoskovsk. Nataliya sells men's clothing items. Her kiosk is located in a busy place at the market. This is an important factor impacting the growth of Nataliya's venture. Her professional marketing skills only add to its success. 

Nataliya has been in business for seven years. Presently, she has 40,000 UAH in inventory. Her profit amounts to approximately $900 a month. Nataliya is seeking a loan of 16,400 UAH to purchase seasonal merchandise for the upcoming fall season. She is planning to open one more vending location in the near future. One of her long term plans is to help her children start their own businesses.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise to sell

loans.name: Danira

texts.en:
Danira V. is 22 and married with three children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Danira has 3 years of experience in this business.  Danira needs a loan of WST 1900 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Danira joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Danira's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en: Hakima is a widowed mother of two children. Her fabric-sales business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past four years that she’s been in business. Hakima is a hard-working, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs. Hakima has requested a loan of $1,500 to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for sewing national dresses for women

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Yadira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yadira De Los Ángeles tiene 55 años de edad, ellas es una persona muy emprendedora, inicio su negocio hace 15 años con un pequeño capital propio ya que su esposo le ayudaba a elaborar sus diferentes platillos que ofrece. Este negocio le genera buenos ingresos que le sirven para solventar sus gastos de la casa, ella tiene cinco hijos pero ninguno está bajo su cargo, pues trabajan de manera independiente. Solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, bolsas, utensilios para cocina entre otros así lograra incrementar su negocio y tener aún mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yadira De Los Ángeles is a 55-year-old enterprising woman who started her business 15 years ago with a small amount of her own capital. Her husband used to help her prepare the different dishes she sells. This business generates good profits, which she uses to cover the household expenses. She has five children, but none of them are under her care because they all work independently. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase staple grains, vegetables, bags, and cooking utensils, among other things, so that she can expand her business and boost profits, thus improving her quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun L. is 31 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and two young children. Since 2003, he has been operating a moto-taxi, a motorbike with a trailer attached. On average, he is able to make about $7 of profit every day, while his wife is a garment factory worker, making $3 a day. 

To earn more income, Lun L. is asking for a loan of $700 to open a coffee shop.

loans.use: To open a coffee shop

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora S. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnuts, and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell. Flora is 32 years old and is married to an army man. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros L. is from the village of Benhaan in Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Milagros is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Milagros runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste & detergent powder in the local community. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Milagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be Milagros's 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Norma Catalina

texts.es:
La Señora Norma L. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su cultura y tradiciones, siendo su gente calida y amable. 

La Señora Norma tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 7 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segundo hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es maestro en la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

Doña Norma es comerciante hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada americana, labora de 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde pero solo 3 días a la semana, los demás días se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga que es socia del banco comunal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio. Su sueño sería no tener más deudas.
texts.en:
Señora Norma L. is a member of the El Ahorro ("The Savings") communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca, a city which is reknowned for the architectural beauty of its historic centre, its culture and traditions, and for the warmth of its people.

Señora Norma is 38 years old, and is married with 3 children, age 19, 7 and 1. Her eldest son works, and helps with the household expenses. Her second son is at school in the city. Her husband is a master builder. They do not have their own house, but live in the house of a relative.  

Señora Norma has been a businesswoman for 15 years. She sells used clothing, working from 7am until 6pm, but only 3 days per week. The other days she dedicates to looking after her children. 

This is her first loan with the communal bank, after she was invited to join by a friend who was already a member. She is going to invest her loan in buying more clothing to stock her business. Her dream is to have no more worries.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan P. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Susan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods & instant noodles in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Susan is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & biscuits. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like beverages & biscuits

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy crates of drinks and yards of carpet.

loans.name: Abdias

texts.es:
Abdías es un padre de familia de 51 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de primera necesidad, así como abarrotes y artículos diversos. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida ya que el siempre trata de brindarle a sus clientes una atención de calidad. Como esta es la fuente más importante de ingresos con la que cuenta, siempre se esfuerza por mantener su negocio del mejor modo posible.

Actualmente Abdías desea ampliar su negocio comprando más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Abdias is a family man who is 51 years old and who lives together with his wife and their son in the district of Cayatli. It is an agricultural region with regular commercial activities. It is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

He has a grocery store installed in his home and he offers his clients various basic needs products, including groceries, and various merchandise. The business has a steady client base, given that he always works to provide his clients with quality customer service. This is his most important source of income so he always works to maintain his business in the best way possible.  

Abdias wishes to expand his business with the purchase of more products. He wishes to satisfy the client demand. He has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the  amount of 1000 nuevos soles, which will be help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, es una joven mujer trabajadora, que vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). Todas las mañanas los comerciantes y visitantes del mercado central de la ciudad de San Ramón, visitan el puesto de comida de Delia, para saborear los ricos platos de comida que prepara. Su secreto es cocinar con mucho amor y cariño, ya tiene 2 años dedicándose a esto.  Por eso sus planes es ahorra lo necesario para poder generar un capital de trabajo necesario como para abrir su propio restaurante, y de esa manera expandirse más. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Claveles”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde es una socia responsable y trabajadora. Delia, comprará con el crédito solicitado insumos necesarios como: arroz, azúcar y demás ingredientes para la preparación de comida que expende.
texts.en:
Delia is a young working woman who lives with her husband and children in Playa Hermosa, San Ramón, in the central Peruvian jungle. Every morning both vendors and visitors in the central market of San R. stop by Delia's food stall to savour the delicious meals that she prepares. Her secret to cooking well is to cook with a lot of love and care, having spent two years preparing meals. Her plan is to save what she can to generate the working capital that she needs to open her own restaurant and expand her business further. 

Delia is a responsible and hardworking member of the community bank “Los Claveles” (The Carnations) and this is her second loan with MFP. Delia will use this loan to purchase necessary ingredients including rice, sugar and other ingredients to prepare the meals that she makes.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and other ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly J. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 61 years old and married with three adult children. Shirly operates a family member’s general store (sari-sari) in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

Shirly joined PMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase materials for her store renovation. Shirly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Shirly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Vida Luz

texts.es: Vida Luz esta señora tiene una pulpería, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio por la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su familia, a pesar de los diferentes desafíos como es el aumento de los precios de algunos productos. Su deseo es que su negocio salga adelante para que sea auto sostenible además le gustaría que su negocio aumentara. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para comprar jabón, detergente, granos básicos, golosinas, y otros productos para el hogar.
texts.en: Vida Luz has a small general store.  She is a very hardworking woman who has had this business for more than 3 years.  She started the business because she needed to cover the household expenses, and she was facing a challenge in this regard because of rising prices.  She hopes that her business can continue to move forward and become self-sustaining, and in addition, she would like for her business to grow.  The financing that she requests is for working capital that she will use to buy soap, detergent, staple grains, candy, and other household products.

loans.use: working capital to buy soap, detergent, staple grains, candy, and other household products

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne N. N. is a member of Royal Success group under Faulu Kenya.  She runs the Josan tailoring business and has been in the business for six years.  She was previously selling shoes.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to run her business.  In five years, she hopes to open a tailoring shop where she will be selling fabric, threads, and buttons.  She has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man who lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with his family. He has 2 children aged 24 and 22.

Nelson is a farmer. He plants and harvests rice and corn crops. He sells his harvest to the people in his community. Nelson wishes to have a stable business. He wants to be able to provide for all his family's needs.

Nelson has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 57 years old. Teresita is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling flowers like roses & babies breath in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional flowers & for working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of flowers. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of flowers.

loans.name: Zenith Del Carmen

texts.es: Zenith P. vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena D. Indias, ciudad costera al Norte D. Colombia, con su esposo y tiene tres hijos en las edades D. 25 a 31 años D. edad, uno D. los cuales ya es profesional; En el barrio donD. habita Zenith tiene una papelerìa donD. aprovecha su espacio para prestar el  internet, actividad con la que sueña ampliarla porque  la percibe como fuente D. ingresos  para ella y en el futuro para sus hijos. El negocio naciò por que ella es muy conciente D. las oportunidads D. ingreso pues en su barrio no existe aun punto D. ventas D. productos D. papelerìa y aun menos servicios D. comunicaciòn especialidad via internet; fue asì como decidida  y con esfuerzo propio, la emprendiò  con pocos productos y cuando sintìo la gran acogida D. sus clientes empezò a reinvertirle D. acuerdo con lo que este gradualmente le generaba, fue asì como lo hizo crecer, y hasta el momento ha sido una fuente D. ingresos importante para ella y su familia, por eso se ha entusiasmado y està solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, para tener un capital D. trabajo adicional con el cual responder rapidamente a sus clientes, con su credikiva  comprarà  cuadernos, làpices, sacapuntas, borradores y utiles escolares en general, inversion que proyecta ser exitosa porque no tiene competencia a su alrededor y todos conocen que ir a comprar donD. Zenith es mas facil que trasladarse a puntos comerciales con estas mismas caracteristicas, pues quedan lejos D. su vivienda.
texts.en:
Zenith P. lives in the city of Cartagena D. Indias, a coastal city in northern Colombia, with her husband and three children, who are ages 25 to 31 years old.  One of her children is already a young professional.  

In her neighborhood, Zenith has a stationary store, which she also uses as a space to proviD. internet services.  She dreams of expanding this activity to proviD. a larger source of income for herself and in the future for her children.  The business started because she is very aware of the income opportunities in her neighborhood.  There were no places that sold stationary and even less places that provided special communication services via internet.  That is how she decided, with great determination and effort, to undertake a business with a few products.  When she felt the great success of having customers, she began to reinvest her generated earnings.  This is how the business has grown and so far has been a source of income for her and her family.

She is excited and seeking her first loan through the Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo to have additional working capital with which to respond quickly to her customers.  With the requested loan she will buy notebooks, pencils, pencil sharpeners, erasers, and general school supplies.  This is an investment that she projects will be successful because there is no competition around and everyone knows to buy from her store.  It is easier to broaden her sales zone with similar products.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pencils, pencil sharpeners, erasers, and other school supplies.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip M. is 30 years old and married with two school-aged children. Philip is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns approximately PHP 8,000 per month. 

Philip is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. He has been growing vegetables for almost two years.

In the future, Philip hopes to have a plentiful harvest and earn more income to support the education of his children. He believes that with his patience and strong determination, he can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 39 years old.  He is married to Nancy, who also contributes to the family income.  Moses has been running his grocery store for a period of about ten years and earns an income of KES 14,000 a month.   This is his fourth loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous ones.  Moses wants to use this loan to buy stock of clothes and vegetables for his store.  His dream is to be a wholesaler of new clothing.

loans.use: buy stocks of clothes and vegetables for his store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 31 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  For 14 years, she has earned a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Elena is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough for her business expansion and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith has a mixed farm in the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya that produces cabbages, potatoes, maize and peas. She has been in the farming business for 10 years and sells all her products locally. She is 32 years old and married with two children who both attend school.

She has made a loan request of 47,250 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from this loan will help her improve her family's livelihood. She faces the challenge of the high cost of animal feed and disease, which affects her production. She plans to acquire two more dairy cows and construct a zero grazing unit in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sarouet

texts.en:
Sarouet, 38, is a grocery seller. Her husband is a car driver and sometime he does motorbike taxi driving to get more income. Their income is $10 per day. They have five children, three are studying and one works in a cosmetic shop earning $5 per day. Every month, Sarouet has to spend $75 on food, $15 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. 

Sarouet would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a new motorbike for her husband's motorbike taxi service because the current motorbike is old and needs a lot of repairs. In the future she wants to extend her shop to sell more grocery goods so that she can earn more income to support the rest of her children who are studying so they can finish university.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's taxi service

loans.name: Kubriyokhon

texts.ru: Кубрёхон проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. Ее муж находится на заработках в России. У нее двое детей. Сама она занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает женские национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Она берет кредит для покупки платьев с вышивками.
texts.en: Kubriyokhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 43 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband currently works in Russia.  Kubriyokhon is involved in retail sales.  She has a store, where she sells women's national dresses.  She has been involved in this business for ten years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of embroidered dresses.

loans.use: to purchase embroidered dresses

loans.name: Benkola  D Group

texts.fr:
BENKOLA D est un regroupement de dix membres qui sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le niébé, le pois de terre et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, FANTA qui est la première assise à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions, après un certains temps de garde, sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
BENKOLA D is a group of ten members who are married women with an average age of 34 and on average three children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco,  Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice, "niébé" (a local grain), Bambera peas, and peanuts. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this first loan, FANTA, who is seated, first on the left, intends to buy farm inputs and  small agricultural material, and pay plowing expenses to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.

After being stockpiled for a certain time, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of 20,000 F CFA, more or less, per season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, farm inputs and small agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila, de 51 años convive con Víctor, su esposo. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Juana, Elmer y Eloy en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. A pesar de su edad, está extraordinaria mujer trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Su fuerza lo lleva en los años de vitalidad que tiene. La siembra de tubérculos como papa y oyuco; es su principal actividad económica. Ya tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Pero según afirma, lo que más le gusta a ella, es cuidar de sus 20 cabezas de ganado vacuno, los que enseba, y después los vende en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Desde adolescente Teofila, comenzó a apoyar a sus padres en el cuidado y mejora de sus cultivos, y hasta ahora se siente feliz de poder pasar sus días en el campo; además de recibir el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes aprendieron de ella y su esposo, todo lo necesario para comenzar por si solos a sembrar; “esto es un oficio de familia”, afirma Teofila. Que tiene pensando seguir mejorando la calidad de sus productos, con ello podrá vender a mayor precio sus cosechas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, que lo integra personas responsables y comprometidas. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Teofila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío.
texts.en: Teofila is 51 years old. She lives with Víctor, her husband. They have 6 children, but only 3 of them live with them, Juana, Elmer and Eloy. They live in their own house in the community of Ricrican. Despite her age, this extraordinary woman works very hard to get ahead. Her strength brings vitality to her years. She plants tubers such as potatoes and oyuco. It's her main economic activity. She has been farming for more than 20 years. According to her, what she likes the most is caring for her 20 heads of cattle. She fattens them up and then sells them in the central market of the city of Tarma. Since she was a teenager, Teofila started to help her parents taking care of and improving their crops and she still feels happy being able to spend her time in the country. She also receives her children's help. They learned from her and her husband everything they needed to start to plant on their own. "This is a family business", Teofila affirms. She plans on continuing to improve the quality of her products. That way, she can sell her crops at a better price. She belongs to the “Mirando a un futuro mejor” [Looking to a Better Future] community bank and this is her sixth loan with MFP. She feels happy belonging to her community bank, which is made up of responsible and dedicated people. In addition, she promises to make her payments on time. If Teofila receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in buying natural fertilizer for her next planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: l'emprunteur est un jeune coordonnier qui vient juste de se marier. Il répare et confectionne des chaussures qu'il revend sur le marché local.Il achéte aussi à l'occasion des fetes des sacs et des chaussures.Il ne vit pas avec son épouse mais avec sa maman et un frére qui souffre d'une maladie mental.L'ainé de la famille est décédé ainsi que le pére de famille. Il a déja obtenu trois prets de l'IMCEC remboursés entierement. Il sollicite un autre pret de 100 000F avec lequel il compte acheter 25 sacs et 45 pairs de chaussures.Son ambition est de faire assez de bénéfices pour entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: The borrower is a young cobbler who has just married.  He repairs and makes shoes which he sells at the local market. He also occasionally buys bags and shoes to resell. He does not live with his wife but with his mother and a brother who suffers from mental illness. Both his father and eldest brother are dead. He has already had three loans from the IMCEC which he has duly repaid. He is requesting another loan of 100 000F with which he will buy 25 bags and 45 pairs of shoes. His ambition is to make enough profit to support his family.

loans.use: Buy 25 bags and 45 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married and has a 4-year-old son. She sells women’s clothing at Krytiy market in Zaporozhye city. Olga started this business five years ago with the help of her mother who is also a market vendor. She purchased the initial inventory for Olga. 

Today, Olga attracts her clients with the quality and variety of her inventory and she would like to expand her business. Olga is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to purchase women’s coats. She hopes to increase her sales and income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase women’s coats to sell in the market.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es: Marino tiene 30 años, es soltero, y vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva fortaleza, Pichari. Él es un hombre de buenos principios, trabajador y su fin es tener una  vejez tranquila y sin carecer de necesidades. La agricultura, es una que actividad que por tradición familiar lo han ejercido durante mucho tiempo, hoy marino continúa en el mismo camino, pese además que no terminó de estudiar debido a que sus padres no tenía el capital suficiente para apoyarlo. Es así que incursiona en el cultivo de cacao, trabajando duro desde que amanece hasta que se oculta el sol. Por otro lado, su trabajo es mucho más eficiente, pues utiliza una técnica mejor que la tradcional, por lo que logrará cosechar en menor tiempo, además la calidad de los frutos han tenido mejor demanda de los acopiadores. En adelante desearía tener un terreno donde pueda montar un vivero, para que pueda injertar plantas de cacao, así obtendría un fruto de mayor proporción. Es por esta razón que Marino recurre a MFP, para solicitar un préstamo con la finalidad de realizar su anhelado deseo. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 soles que solicita, podrá instalar un vivero de plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Marino is 30 years old and single.  He lives in his own house, located in the community of Nueva Fortaleza, Pichari. He is an upright and hardworking man.  His goal is to have a quiet and comfortable retirement. Farming has been his family's traditional occupation for many years. Today, Marino continues to follow this path, partly since he could not finish school because his parents did not have enough money to support him.  That's how he started cultivating cocoa, working hard from dawn until dusk.  These days, however, his work is much more efficient, as he uses a technique that is better than the traditional one.  So he harvests his crop in less time, plus the quality of his fruit has led to an increased demand from the wholesalers. 

Marino would like to have land where can build a nursery so that he can graft cocoa plants and thereby get more fruit. This is the reason he has come to microfinance partner MFP to ask for a loan to fulfill his goals.  This will be his first loan with MFP, and he promises to pay his installments punctually.  With the 1,000 soles ($375) he is requesting, he will be able to install a nursery for the cocoa plants.

loans.use: to install a nursery.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustin de 41 años de edad trabaja para El Hospital del Rama desde hace 23 años, desempeñandose como Enfermero Asistencial. Esta solicitando  su 7mo. credito con el objetivo de terminar la construccion de los cuartos en su casa, pues con el credito anterior no culmino la obra, solamente levanto paredes y ahora quiere terminar los detalles que le quedaron pendientes como repellar y embaldosar los cuartos y asi contar con mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Agustin is 41 years old and has worked for the Hospital del Rama for the last 23 years as a nurse's assistant. He is asking for his 7th loan with the purpose of finishing the construction of the rooms in his house as with the previous loan the work was not completed, only the walls built. He now wants to finish the details that were pending such as plastering and tiling the rooms and so improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to finish building.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en: Glenn is 51 years old. He is married with 2 children. Glenn has a store and owns a video karaoke unit for entertainment, where customers pay per song.  He has had this business for 12 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional items to sell in the store and for the maintenance of the karaoke unit. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Glenn hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to provide maintenance on his karaoke unit and to buy additional items to sell in the store.

loans.name: Oganes

texts.en:
Oganes is a young farmer from the village of Atskuri, South Georgia. He is 22 years old and lives with his family: a 20-year-old sister (a student), his parents, an uncle, and his 72-year-old grandmother. 

Family members earn a living through agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where maize and potatoes are grown. Harvested vegetables are sold in nearby villages and towns. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris (approximately $330 USD). 

Oganes requested credit to purchase a horse. He will use it for transportation of harvested products to nearby villages. The family has good conditions for keeping the domestic animal, including a building, which will be used as a stable. The horse will also help Oganes in tilling family-owned lands, where maize will be sown. 

In the future, the family will cultivate more land and sow more corn. Accordingly, their income from corn sales will increase and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a horse

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se forma gracias a que una de las miembros, la cual le dijo a sus amigas y vecinas para formar el comité y ellas gustosas aceptaron. Todas quieren que, por medio del trabajo de cada una de ellas, puedan ayudar a sus familias y sus hijos, dándoles una vida digna y decorosa.
Un ejemplo de lucha es la señora Pascuala, ella tiene una panadería, la cual es el sustento de su casa y de su familia, comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y buena atención ya tiene una clientela bien formada, lo cual le trae muy buenos ingresos, es por ello que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya, para la compra de harina, leudantes, saborizantes y demás, los cuales son ingredientes esenciales de su negocio.
Ella al igual que sus amigas están muy agradecidas por esta oportunidad que tienen.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to one of the members who suggested to her friends and neighbors that they form a communal bank, to which they happily agreed. All want, through their individual work to be able to help their families and children by giving them a decent and dignified life. 

Sra. Pascuela is one example of the struggle. She owns a bakery, which supports her household and family. She notes that, thanks to her efforts and close attention, she already has an established clientele which generates a very good income. Consequently, she wants to continue investing in her business and is requesting help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya in order to purchase flour, leavening, seasoning and other items which are essential ingredients for her business.

She, together with her friends, is very grateful for the opportunities afforded them.

loans.use: to buy flour, leavening, seasoning and other items.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr:
Aline  est secrétaire du groupe de crédit  nuru, cliente de l’IMF Hekima au 16e cycle, âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de trois enfants qui vont tous à l’école.  
Elle a commencé son petit commerce en 2000 avec son fond propre, pour le moment elle a crée  son propre  restaurant.  Avec ce  crédit  elle va s’approvisionner en vivres et en boissons pour le bon fonctionnement de son activité.    Dans l’avenir elle souhaite agrandir son restaurant  et construire sa propre maison. 
Elle remercie l’IMF hekima  pour les crédits qu’elle reçoit sa garantie matérielle car elle arrive a subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aline is the secretary for the Nuru credit group and a customer of IMF Hekima who is on her 16th loan. She is 38 years old, married and mother to three children who are all at school. She began her small business in 2000 with her own capital and has set up her own restaurant. With this loan she is going to get supplies of food and drink so that she can run her business properly. In the future she would like to expand her restaurant and build her own house.

She is grateful to IMF Hekima for the loans she has received and its practical guarantee that allows her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a welder, and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Imelda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 38,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Imelda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.
