loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with three children. She is 56 years old and resides in Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lilia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. 

Lilia requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more products to resell.  She has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to make an expansion to her business.

loans.use: buy more products to resell

loans.name: Sènami Christine

texts.fr: Sènami Christine est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Anasthase. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sènami Christine  et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sènami Christine  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Sènami Christine  mène comme activité depuis onze ans environs, la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (bols en séries, glacières, plats, etc.) de façon ambulante et aussi par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Sènami Christine  vend des friperies et des sacs de sortie. Sènami Christine  s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son chiffre d’affaire, Sènami Christine  sollicite pour la sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Senami Christine is 36 years old and is married to one Anastasius. The couple has two children both in school and who are their dependents. Senami Christine and her husband handle jointly the various family expenses.

Senami Christine has not attended school. To provide for her needs and those of her family over the past eleven years, she has been running a businees selling kitchenware (bowl sets, coolers, dishes, etc.), as an itinerant vendor and also through the distribution system. She also sells second-hand clothing and handbags as a second source of income, and resupplies in Benin and Togo.

In order to raise the level of her business activities and increase her customer base and turnover, Senami Christine is requesting for the sixth time a credit loan from ALIDé. All previously received funds have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy kitchenware (bowl sets, dishes, coolers, etc.)

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old, married and has nine children.  To earn a living, he runs a cafeteria.  He has been in the business for eleven years.  He has employed ten people in his business.  He also practices livestock farming for extra income.

Peter has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to his livestock.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 7. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a favorable area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of vegetables and fruits. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Joyce's business goal is to venture into selling cereals within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Es un señor amable de 48 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Trabaja desde hace 25 años como docente de educación primaria en esa área laboral. Debido a su bajo salario y a la urgencia de comprar uniformes para su trabajo y cubrir los gastos de graduación de uno de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar telas, para la elaboración de sus uniformes y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construirle a su familia una vivienda de concreto, ya que es de mayor durabilidad.

loans.use: para comprar telas, para la elaboración de sus uniformes y cubrir los costos de mano de obra

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 61 years old, married with two children.

Ma. Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, coffee, drinks, noodles, snack foods and etc.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, coffee, drinks, noodles, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Salome would like to pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Ally

texts.en:
Ally sells used clothes in a busy area of Ilala district of Dar es Salaam. He has five years experience in this business. He buys bundles of used clothes from wholesalers, repairs and cleans them before he offers them for resale. This business has helped him generate income for his family of a wife and three children.

He wants to diversify his business by adding shoes. His strategy requires an expansion of the current premise, buying a stock of shoes and a reserve of working capital.

Ally is well known in his area and he is sure to make good sales with this new business. A loan of USD550 will help him implement the strategy.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and clothing sales

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann S. is 40 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has four children. One of her children is employed at a garment factory, another one is a student, and the rest are still too young to attend school.

To supplement her family’s income, Ms. Vann S. and her husband (pictured here) run a small cart selling Khmer noodle to the people in front of a garment factory. This earns them on average around $3/day in revenue.

Recently, this couple needs a motorcycle so that they can pull their food cart in order to make their business more efficient and effective. Thus, they are asking for $1,000 in order to make this investment. They are much thankful for your trust and support!

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle to help in her food business.

loans.name: Alfa

texts.en:
Alfa S. J. is married and has seven children. Like the majority of the Fulah tribesmen in the Koinadugu district, he is engaged in the buying and selling of sheep. With his previous loan, he purchased three sheep and one calf. He paid his loan installments with the income from petty trading that is being managed by his wife.

He is now requesting a loan of US$ 175 to purchase two more calves. Alfa said, with a lump sum of cash from SMT, he will be able to increase the number of cows in the shortest time.

loans.use: Purchase additional livestock for rearing

loans.name: Venise

texts.en: Venise's work consists of running a 6-acre taro plantation which is tended by her husband and four laborers.  Most of her family moved overseas but she chose to remain in Samoa and continue her taro plantation. She goes to the market twice a month and makes 300-400 Tala ($120-160 US) each visit.

loans.use: To buy supplies, such as fertilizers, spades, and knives, for her plantation

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Adzo K. is 40, married, and the mother of two children.She has owned a little general store for more than 5 years. Her husband is polygamous and manages to just get by. The income from Adzo's business allows her to pay the school fees for her children as well as covering the simple needs of her family.

Adzo is good at running her business and has a devoted and steadily growing clientele. She is hoping to use the requested loan to diversify her inventory so as to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Adzo K. est agée de quarante ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est propriétaire de boutique d'alimentation générale depuis plus de 5 ans . Son mari est poligame et se débrouille dans la vie. Le revenu de son activité lui permet de scolariser ses enfants et de financer les besoins élémentaires du foyer. Elle maîtrise bien son activité et a une clientèle fidèle et en pleine croissance. Elle désire avec ce crédit diversier la vente de son stock afin de satisfaire la clientèle

loans.use:
purchasing food items in Lomé for re-sale in Kpalimé

Achat des produits alimentaires à Lomé pour les revendre à Kpalimé

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Mr Vincent A. is the person dressed in the red sports shirt. He 29 years old and is a father of two children, first of whom is in the fifth grade and the second in the middle of the first grade. Mr Vincent works in the coffee industry, which is the second agricultural product exported after cocoa. His work is very profitable since he is the only person who has the permit to work in the area. He has worked in this sector for the last 5 years, and with his income, he is able to support his family as well as save some money. With the money saved, he would like to buy a second gining machine to better meet the population's nees and to better support his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Vincent A. est celui habillé en polo rouge. Il est âgé de 29, marié et père de 02 enfants dont le premier est en classe de cinquième et le second au cours moyen première année. Monsieur Vincent opère dans l’égrainage du café qui est le deuxième produit agricole exporté après le cacao. Son activité est très rémunératrice puisqu’il est la seule personne à pouvoir s’installer dans la zone. Il opère dans ce secteur depuis 05 ans et avec ses revenus il supporte les charges de sa famille et faire une épargne. Il souhaite avec ces fonds acquérir un deuxième égraineur pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la population et de mieux supporter sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and installation of a second ginning machine

loans.name: Buguwa Ii B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joy T.. She is currently operating a retail shop and is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator. Joy is 36 years old and is married to a farmer. She has 3 children, ranging from 6 to 18 years old. Her children go to school. Each week, Joy makes approximately UGX 20000 in profit. With the extra profits she will make with the help of a loan, she hopes to be able to cater to her basic needs. Joy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, to the amount of UGX 300000, in order to start a wholesale business. The loan was paid back on time.

Joy is joined in her small group by Tisame N., Pauline N., Rebecca B. and Hellen K.. Tisame N. has a business selling used clothing and wants to start up a clothing boutique. Pauline N. is currently operating a retail shop and wants a loan to open up another shop in town. Hellen K. sells shoes and wants to start up a retail shop. Rebecca B. has a fish selling business and wants to invest in her business with the loan.

loans.use: to invest in a retail shop business

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is 54 years old and has been raising cattle for the last 27 years. During those years, two of his children became adults and now help him, as does his wife. Currently Amin has 6 head of cattle in the household. This type of business is both time-consuming and labor-consuming. At the same time, it generates stable profits.

In spring Amin plans to purchase three more cows and the fodder for them. For this purpose, he requests US $600.00 for 8 months. This is Amin's first loan and he is grateful to everyone for trusting and supporting him. He promises not to let his supporters down.

loans.use: To expand a cattle business

loans.name: Salamotu

texts.en: Mrs. Salamotu M. has been a faithful client of LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. She is 36 years old and has 3 children. She sells groceries in cartons (wholesale). She hails from Ajambgadi, Lagos State, Nigeria and has being in business since 1999. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provision for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
Marie came to our office with her precious 1-year old son and 9 other women from her community to learn more about the loans that we could give them. She has lived in Basurero, on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, with her husband and two children for 15 years. Her husband works in a small jewelry shop, but she has not been able to work because of her two small children, and the lack of opportunity. With this loan she wants to buy clothes, shoes, and hair products to sell in her community. Her dream is that if her and her husband work hard they can provide a better life for their children, and send them to University.

Esperanza is so privileged to work with these women, and we want to thank Kiva lenders for their support. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, shampoo, and conditioner

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en: Valeh M. is a 48-year-old man who sells dairy and breeds calves for meat production in the southern region of Bilasuvar in the Internally Displaced People Settlement. He has more than 15 years of experience in this field. His main source of income for his wife and four children is selling calves, and the cow is just for family needs. As summer is high season for wedding parties, Valeh would like to expand his business and sell calves during this period. For this purpose Valeh applied for $900 US to purchase three calves for $300 US each.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Ofu

texts.en:
Ofu V., 49, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the grocery business. She sells to the whole district community and relatives, and also tourists as they drive past, 7 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Ofu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will also support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband is self-employed and works to maintain the business.

loans.use: Purchase a sack of rice, flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, snacks and twisties, bag of chewing gum and lollies, a new scale, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel lives in his grandparent's house, in the area of Alto Sopocachi in the city of La Paz and helps his mother by working since he doesn't have a father and have younger siblings. He lives in a room that he shares with his siblings.

The loan will be used for the purchase of clothing garments (sweater, pants, shoes, etc.) and to be able to sell on credit in various places in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. This loan is very important for Angel, and will be of great help since it will increase his income, thus improving the quality of life for him and his siblings.

This is the first time that he has requested a loan and needs Kiva's help in order to make his dream of having his own business a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Angel vive en la casa de sus abuelos, en la zona de alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz y ayuda a su mama a trabajar ya que no tiene papa y si hermanos menores. Vive en un cuarto el cual lo comparte con sus hermanos El crédito será destinado para la compra de prendas de vestir (chompas, pantalones, zapatos, etc.) y poder vender al crédito en distintos lugares de las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto. Este crédito es muy importante para Angel pues será de gran ayuda ya que aumentara su nivel de ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida y el de sus hermanos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, y requiere la ayuda de Kiva para hacer realidad su sueño de tener su propio negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, sweaters, pants, shoes, etc, for his businesss

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario S. acaba de recibir su casa pero le está haciendo falta los protecciones para poder  vivir en ella para que su hijo y esposa tengo un lugar seguro donde estar ya que están viviendo en casa de la mama de su esposa, y su esposa está a punto de dar a luz un nuevo integrante a la familia  y el quiere ya estar en su nueva casa cunado llegue su nuevo hijo.
 El Trabaja en una compañía de refrescos en el aria de repartidor y ventas esté es el ingreso de su familia. Por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar las protecciones de su casa.
El Sr. Mario se acerco a las oficinas de pedir información sobre nuestros créditos y le pareció excelente saber que excite una compañía como Kiva que le puede ayudar a mejorar su vivienda para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
 Mario esta solicitando un préstamo de $425.00 dlls para la colocación de las protecciones a su casa
texts.en:
Mario S. is the new owner of a house that is lacking a protective fence. Mario needs the protective fence to be able to live securely in his new home with his wife and son. They are currently living in his mother-in-law's house, with his wife on the verge of giving birth. He would like to already be living in his new home when his second child is born. Mario works for a refreshment company as a distributor, and his sales constitute his family's income. At the moment, he does not have sufficient funds to pay for a fence for his house. Mario approached the FVP offices to solicit information about our loans. He thought it was excellent to find out that a company like FVP exists that can help him to improve his house to give his family a better life. Mario is requesting a loan of $425 to build a protective fence around his house.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a protective fence.

loans.name: Felauai

texts.en: Felauai I., 48, is married with five children. She has 3 years of experience in the Flea Market business. She sells Samoan bags, kava bouls, earrings (sets), carvings and other Samoan weapons to the public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Felauai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. all will be use to fund business. Her husband doesn't work but he also helps out with the business.

loans.use: Felauai would like to purchase items to resell at the flea market.

loans.name: Mwanabaraka

texts.en:
Mwanabaraka P. has been a tailor in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $40 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Mwanabaraka is 20 years old, married, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rompiendos Obstaculos Group

texts.en: Being a single mother is never an easy thing, and it is especially difficult when the mother doesn't have a job and has 4 children. This is the situation that Maria V. faces each day. She is living in extreme poverty, and her children have to work just so the whole family can eat. Nobody in the family has a steady income, and the whole family is just living day to day. Marie decided she wanted to change her situation, so she came to Esperanza International (Kiva's Field Partner) asking for a loan so she can start her very own business. She is planning on starting a small business selling used clothing. She is a very good seamstress, so she wanted to do something where she could use her talents. She is one of the rare women in her situation because she is still able to dream. She dreams of sending all 4 of her children to college someday, and she knew that if she wanted that dream to come true she would have to change her life. She feels that having her own business is the way to realize that dream. She is a hard worker and ready to take on this challenge. She is going to be a success someday, and her whole family is going to benefit from it!!

loans.use: To buy used clothing and start a business

loans.name: Les

texts.en: Mr. Les S. is a farmer in Kro Sas Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. He owns one hectare of land on which he cultivates rice. He earns less income than he needs to provide a good life for his family. In order to improve his standard of living, he decided to request a loan to add to his savings. He will use the loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice and he hopes to increase his revenue in this way. His wife, Mrs. Nos Khor, is a chicken middleman. Mr. Les S. has two children who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is also presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land on which to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Fadlallah

texts.en:
Fadlallah is a 52 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Fadlallah has been working as a sewer for twenty five years. Fadlallah is special in his work because he is good and has a lot of experience. His clients are friends, neighbors, schools and stores. When he first started his business he had difficulty building a network but no longer. In the future, he plans to purchase a new sewing machine.
 
He has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business. Fadlallah has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time.  His previous loans have helped him improve his standard of living and he wants to do more.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 32 años y vive con sus dos queridos hijos en un cuarto alquilado, ella trabaja duro, para poder brindarles más comodidades. Ella vende ropa para pagar los estudios de sus 2 menores hijos, se levanta todos los días muy temprano y lleva su mercadería hasta la ciudad de Puno, donde la vende en un puesto que tiene en la feria sabatina, le gusta mucho vender ropa y ganar dinero, con el cual pueda cuidar a sus hijos, anhela poner una tienda grande de ropa, donde pueda vender prendas surtidas y accesibles para sus clientes. Para ella trasladar su mercadería hasta Puno es lo más difícil de su trabajo, ya que siempre lleva gran cantidad y a veces los carros no la quieren recoger, pero ha sabido arreglárselas sola en los 10 años que tiene en este negocio, lo que más quiere es brindarle a sus hijos unos buenos estudios, para que sean grandes profesionales. Es el tercer préstamo que Ruth saca en MFP, no quiere fallar en el pago de sus cuotas, porque sabe que eso le traería problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual ella es una de las socias más antiguas. El dinero solicitado le servirá para comprar más mercadería, invertirá mil soles en ello,  con el resto del dinero arreglara su puesto de venta para que se vea mas elegante.
texts.en:
Ruth A. I. is a single mother, 32 years old, who lives in a rented room with her two dear children. She works very hard to provide a comfortable life for her children. In order to allow her children to attend school, Ruth sells clothing. Every day she gets up quite early in the morning to carry her merchandise to the city of Puno where she has a stall in the Sabatina Market. She very much likes being able to sell the clothing and earn money which allows her to provide a good life for her children. Her dream is to enlarge her business and sell ever more clothing and a wider variety of accessories for her clients. One of the most difficult parts of her business in the transporting her merchandise - often quite substantial - back and forth to Puno. Many time the local buses won't stop for her because of her load of merchandise. But she has been able to work it out during the ten years she has had her business, and this helps her achieve her goal of getting a good education for her children so they can become professionals. This will be Ruth's third loan from MFP, and doesn't want to miss any payments, knowing that doing so would create a problem for her with this community bank. She is one of their earliest members. The money from this loan will be used in part to buy more merchandise (1,000 Soles) and the rest used to improve the appearance of her sales location.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
S. is 29 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has one child who is still young. She is a widowed mother and has been working as a local farmer on land behind her house since 1996. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. She harvests twice a year on her own farming land inherited from her parents; she has earned a good income from her field.

Recently she wants to increase her income for her family's needs. So S. is looking for a loan of US$ 250 to buy a small plot of farmland next to her house. She dreams of having a degree for her child.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of farmland

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía tiene 57 años, enviudó hace 18 años, tiene 7 hijos, 2 de ellos viven con ella en su casa. Su esposo fue agricultor, en vida adquirió varios terrenos de cultivo para la ocupación de ellos y de sus hijos. Pero ahora Lucía se quedó sola, sus hijos mayores migraron a las ciudades, desde entonces sus siembras han aminorado y solo cultiva para su consumo personal, el resto de las chacras las viene alquilarlos para que le generen ingresos económicos. Ahora dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a la crianza de su ganado, tiene principalmente vacas y carneros. Desde las 5.00am prepara sus alimentos y da de comer a sus perros quienes son expertos en el rodeo de sus corderos y sale a pastear. Lucia está muy feliz con la agricultura y el cuidado de sus animales, y si necesita dinero urgente, vende a alguno de sus animales. Para asistir a todas las reuniones de pago de su banco comunal, ese día da de comer a sus animales en su corral y no sale a pastear. Este su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo demostró pagar puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a preparar sus terrenos de cultivo para que estén listos para su próxima siembra, el resto es para arreglar sus corrales y las necesidades escolares de sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Lucía is 57 and has been widowed for 18 years. She has 7 children, two of which live with her in her home. Her husband was a farmer and acquired land to farm and for his children to live on when he was alive. Now Lucía is alone, and her oldest children have moved to the cities. Since then her plantings have decreased, and she only grows enough for her personal consumption. She rents the rest of the land to generate economic income. Now she dedicates most of her time to raising livestock. She mainly has cows and rams. At 5:00 a.m. she prepares her food and feeds her dogs, who are experts in rounding up the rams, and leaves to graze her animals. Lucía is very happy with agriculture and caring for her animals. If she needs money urgently, she sells some of her animals. To attend all of the payment meetings of her communal bank, on those days she feeds her animals in the corral and they don't go out to graze. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and in all of this time she has repaid them punctually. The money that she is requesting will go towards preparing her farmland so it will be ready for the next planting. The rest will go towards fixing up her corrals and towards the educational needs of her youngest children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare her farmland for planting

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia T. is a 52 year old mother of four. Her husband, Lourdey, is a farmer. The family lives in the last town of Libertad in the northern part of Antique province, Philippines. This is a beautiful village where the mountains meet the sea. Lucia joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) so that she could apply for a loan to buy a pig. This, her first loan, will be used to buy the pig for fattening to augment their income. Lucia hopes to be able to raise more pigs in her backyard in the future so that she can supply meat to her town. She wants to save enough money for her sons and daughters to finish their college education and get good jobs.

loans.use: To buy one head of pig for fattening.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta O., a 55 yr old housewife, is married and mother to four children. She resides in Aloran, Mis Occ. Her business is hog raising. She has to applied to borrow from Paglaum MDC for additional capital for her business. With the loan, she plans to buy feed and supplements for the hogs. Her regular customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends. In the future she plans to buy a land for her piggery and she will renovate the family home someday.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and supplements.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo cuenta con 40 años, esta casado con la Sra. Teresa, contando con una hija de 13 años de edad respectivamente, todos viven juntos y en una casa que es propia, también señalar que cuenta con un vehiculo que el mismo lo trabaja de taxi de día y de noche lo alquila a un chofer  y su esposa se dedica al comercio de cítricos al por menor y mayor entregando directamente al mercado abasto, donde existe buena competencia en los dos rubros, pero la pareja ya cuentan con buena clientela fija con las que trabajan directamente, lo cual le da estabilidad a sus ingresos. El destino del crédito será para la compra de un nuevo motor a su vehiculo y pago de pasivo en agrocapital. La pareja cuenta con un buen comportamiento en sus pagos en agrocapital y otra entidad financiera donde su saldo es pequeño, también señalar que no cuenta con malos antecedentes.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 40 years old, he is married with Teresa and they have a 13 year old daughter and they all live in a house of their own. Also worth mentioning is that they own their own vehicle, and he uses it as a taxi during the day and at night he rents it to a driver, and his wife distributes citrus fruits wholesale to the markets, both occupations being very good fields of work. The couple have built a good and steady client base with whom they work directly, all this yielding a steady income for them. The loan will be destined to purchase a new motor for the vehicle and to invest in a harvest. The couple have been responsible with their payments to Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner) and another financial institution. Their income is modest but they do not have any previous delinquent credit.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has been a food seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to Furaha moyoni group loan (Group code 2072). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 225. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items, to add to her current stock, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwajuma is 35 years old, married, and has four children: ages 19,17, 15 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more food items to add to her current stock

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
Zarifa  B. is 47 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married, and is the loving mother of three children. She started her business 10 years ago.

Now Zarifa dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle.  With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Zarifa is seeking a 2000 USD loan to buy more calves, which she will sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to grow her earnings substantially and to improve her family's quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's request.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Dương Thị

texts.en:
C. Dương Thị (524010591) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has two adult children.

C. owns and operates a service-based business, primarily providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Yethy

texts.es:
Yethy es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Yethy es conviviente tiene 42 años, tiene 3 hijos, los dos últimos  de 11 y 6 años están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Yethy trabajaba en una tienda vendiendo juguetes, por años junto su  dinero, alquilo una tienda y se puso a vender relojes y también vende oro y plata, en el distrito de  San Juan.
Desde que Yethy está en Finca aprendió por las charlas que dan, a como separar el capital de las ganancias, a llevar su libro caja  a manejar mejor su negocio.  
Yethy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para comprar repuestos de  relojes, correas, lunas.  
El sueño de Yethy es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Yethy is a member of the Always Together (Siempre Juntas) Community Bank. She is 42 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. The two youngest are 11 and 6 years old, and they are studying in a government school. Yethy worked in a store selling toys. After some time, she rented a store and was able to sell watches. She also sells gold and silver. Her business is located in the district of San Juan. Since Yethy has been with Finca, she has learned, through the talks that they have, how to separate capital from earnings and to take her savings book to manage her business better. Yehty needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy spare watches, belts, and mirrors. Yethy’s dream is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare watches, belts, and mirrors

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza C. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 33 years old. Maria Liza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Liza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria Liza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Maria Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. Maria Liza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Maria Liza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Pov Y. lives in Prey Kvav village in Takeo province. She owns a grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to re-sell, to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Kum Nub, is a security guard. Mrs. Srey Pov Y. is a 37-year-old mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to re-sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Silvia Cristina

texts.es: La señorita Silvia  Cristina es oricinaria de la comunidad de coxom Totonicapan su principal actividad economica es la elaboración de Blusas para damas ella aprendio el arte hace ocho años  de su querida abuelita, ella necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales, y moldes ya que ha pesnado iniciar su propio negocio, ella manifiesta por la elboracion de un prenda en un tiempo de veinte a veinticindo dias por lo cual necesita de cierto capital para surtir su mercaderia como lo demuestra la fotografia es una actividad que se requiere de mucha paciencia para la elaboracíon

loans.use: Compra de Materiales

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is engaged in a general store business. She sells different commodities such as vegetables, fruits, grocery items, dried fish and a lot more. Her store is located just in front of their house. With the help of lenders, she is positive that all things are possible.  

She is now asking for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to purchase stocks of commodities for her store to earn a bigger income. She hopes that the lenders will give her the chance to improve her business for the benefit of her family.

Angelita is 57 years old and is from the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. She lives happily with her husband, who works as a farmer in their village. They are blessed with a big family. She hopes that her business will be maintained because she believes that her children still need her support financially.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her retail business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia E. is from the village of Banlag, Valencia City. She is 25 years old. Julia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Julia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Julia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Julia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald G., together with his wife Jennifer, has managed a food vending business for almost one year now. They earn a weekly net income of PHP 250. Aside from that, they are also engaged in a hog-raising business. With these businesses, Ronald is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. He will put the funds towards buying additional pigs as well as investing in their food vending business.

Married for almost one year, the couple is still childless but they are earnestly waiting for their little angel to come into their life. They are living peacefully at barangay Del Corpuz, Cabatuan Isabela. Aside from their businesses Ronald also works as a security guard on a night shift. He believes that, with determination and perseverance, he will succeed in life.

loans.use: Additional hogs to raise and additional capital in the food vending business.

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en: Wahida is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Wahida has been selling clothes from her house since 1999. Wahida is special in her work because she sells good quality clothes and has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is her second cycle, and she has always paid on time. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Wahida decided on doing her business because she wanted to be financially independent. In the future, she plans on expanding her work by purchasing a shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work

loans.name: Obed

texts.es: El joven Obed Ramírez Barragán es empresario de un negocio de giro imprenta, diseños de pagina etc. De nombre “Red House “establecido desde hace 3 años, el tiene aun mas proyectos de los que ya ha realizado, y por tal motivo el esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión de nuevos diseños para ofrecerles a sus clientes, ya que los prefieren por su gran calidad y excelencia.
texts.en:
The young Obed Ramírez Barragán has a business that specializes in printing and print design. The business, of the name "Red House," was established 3 years ago. He now has even more projects than he has yet completed, and for this reason he is requesting this loan to invest in new designs to offer to his customers, who prefer him for his high quality and overall excellent service.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in his printing and design business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El señor Jaime tiene 47 años está casado y tienen dos hijos, actualmente su esposa se encuentra en España trabajando, por lo tanto esta solo y dedicándose a su actividad y al cuidado de su hijos, don Jaime es muy responsable por que a pesar que tenía una oferta de trabajo en España junto a su esposa a decidido quedarse junto a sus hijos. Su actividad principal es la producción de leche cruda, cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para la construcción de un establo lo cual le servirá para la protección de su ganado ya que empieza la temporada de lluvia.

Entre sus sueños y metas se encuentra que sus dos hijos estudien una carrera profesional , aumentar  la producción de leche , realizar una construcción nueva a su casa y los mas importante vuelva su esposa para que puedan estar todos juntos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime is 47 years old, married, and had two children. At this time his wife is working in Spain, so he is caring for his children by himself. He is a very responsible person. Even though he had the opportunity to work in Spain with his wife, they decided that he should stay with his children. He sells raw milk to a processing plant that uses it to manufacture milk products. The money from this loan will be used to build a stable to protect his livestock now that the rainy season is beginning. His dreams and goals include: for his children to receive an education and become working professionals; to increase his milk production; build an addition to his home; and most importantly for his wife to return so that they can all be together again.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a stable

loans.name: Luz De Amor 1 And 2 Group

texts.en:
Iris, a 43 year old woman from L. Alcarrizos, acts as the coordinator for the "Luz D. Amor" (Light of Love) group. Iris's story is representative of the other women in this group. 

Iris is a single mother who lives alone with her son in L. Alcarrizos, an urban, industrial area that lies in the outskirts of Santo Domingo, the Dominican capital. The area lacks access to potable water, has unreliable electricity, and inadequate sanitation and health care. 

Iris came to Esperanza seeking a loan to help expand her beauty shop, Salon Iris. Iris will be using the money from this first loan to purchase twenty hair care products for her customers. In the future, Iris wishes to improve her business by purchasing fans for her salon. 

Iris wants to promote the success of her business by saving money to remodel the salon and purchase clothing to sell in the store. Her long term goal is to use the success of her business to support her son. She says, "I want to help my son become useful in his life and in society." 

Iris is grateful for the support of Esperanza and the opportunity to turn her dreams into reality. Thank you for lending to Iris and Luz D. Amor!

loans.use: Hair and beauty products

loans.name: Gema

texts.en: Gema P. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Gema is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gema operates a mini sari sari (variety) store and a little a-la-cart business to sell grilled chicken parts in the local community. Gema has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Gema joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gema has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gema is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Gema from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Florencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 35 años y es madre de 02  hijos que  aun dependen de ella y esta estudiando. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Florencia, se dedica a venta de mercadería de ropas de segunda mano que los ofrece a los pobladores de los pueblos aledaños y le va muy bien,  cuenta con  clientes fijos que la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, en pequeñas cantidad pantalones, camisas, polos, para damas caballeros y niños.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ropas en fardos como: pantalones, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para damas, caballeros y  niños. También trabaja con pedidos. 

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me ofrece el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  de  contar con los préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria,  asimismo con un Micro seguro que me da tranquilidad ante un siniestro inesperado que pueda sucederme así mis hijos no se quedaran sin apoyo y alienta a otras mujeres a pertenecer a los BC y así poder contar con este producto por la minina suma de un nuevo sol.
texts.en:
Senora Florencia belongs to the communal bank “Las Aguerridas II”, Tarapoto district, San Martin province and department. She is 35, living with her spouse and 2 dependent children still in school. She has received her secondary diploma. Florencia sells second-hand clothing to the residents of the surrounding towns, and it is going very well because she has faithful clients who know her and her business. The strength and perseverance that characterize her help her to grow as an independent woman, and she is very proud to have achieved this. With her first loan of $105 she bought small quantities of pants, shirts, and polo shirts for women, men and children. With this loan of $600, she will buy bundles of clothing such as pants, shorts, sneakers, all sizes and styles of blouses, polo shirts, and suits for women, men and children. She also takes orders. She says , "I am grateful for the opportunity offered to me by the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, whose loans help me to develop as a woman and as a small businessperson. Microlending gives me the confidence that if an unexpected disaster happens to me, my children would not be without help. I encourage other women to join communal banks so that they can count on this for the tiny sum of $0.35."

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of clothing

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma P. is from the village of Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Elma is single. To make a living, Elma runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Elma from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Victoria desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene la edad de 34 años, junto a su esposo han logrado construir su casa pero que aun le falta embaldosar el porche, poner verja, pintar entre otras mejoras, en sus prestamos anteriores logro avanzar en esta mejoras para su casa para el bienestar de sus tres hijos, jóvenes que están cursando la secundaria. La señora Victoria también es docente el cual tiene un ingreso fijo a parte de sus ventas el cual inicio con sus ingresos a vender productos de la vogue en donde ha  logrado captar clientes,  trabaja al contado y al crédito. Con este financiamiento desea invertir en cosméticos, perfumenes, ropa variada para dama, niños y caballeros para obtener mejores ventas como mejores utilidades y poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos ya que su trabajo de odontología a veces no esta tan bueno oh te tiene que viajar a los departamento para poder lograr hacer su trabajo. Contenta con los préstamos que la institución ha otorgado ya que se ha beneficiado en mejorar su casa, como aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Victoria, 34, has sold clothing and cosmetics for several years. Together with her husband, she has managed to build her house although the porch still needs to be tiled, iron gates need to be installed and it needs to be painted, among other improvements. She has used her previous loans to move these home improvement projects ahead for the wellbeing of her three children, youngsters who are in secondary school. Victoria is also a teacher, which provides a steady income in addition to her earnings from sales. She started off selling Vogue products and has a regular customer base she can count on; she sells both for cash and on credit. She will use these funds to buy cosmetics, perfumes, assorted clothing for women, children and men so that her sales and profits will improve and she will be able to help her husband, who is a dentist whose work often does not produce enough, even when he travels to other departments to work, to better meet family expenses. She is happy with the loans that the institution has granted her because they have made it possible for her to make improvements to her home and to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children and cosmetics.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Хаитова Адолат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 44 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж в России на зарабатках. Сама Адолат более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Она в основном выращивает овощи. В этом ей помогают дети. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Adolat H. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 44 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in Russia. Adolat has been in agriculture for more than ten years. She mainly grows vegetables. Her children help her with it. She is taking out the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertlizer

loans.name: Presila

texts.es:
Presila es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el sector Lives, una zona rural del distrito de Unión Agua Blanca, perteneciente a la provincia de San Miguel, en la región Cajamarca, una región ubicada en la serranía del país, ubicado a cuatro horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde muy joven, junto a su esposo siembran diversos cultivos y comercializan la leche que producen sus animales. Estos ingresos les han venido sosteniendo desde que se casaron y gracias a estas actividades han sacado adelante a sus hijos los cuales ya se han independizado y formado sus propias familias.

La zona en donde viven se caracteriza por producir diversos granos y cereales. En esta campaña ellos han sembrado maíz y arveja, gracias a estos cultivos esperan captar los ingresos que necesitan para salir adelante durante los siguientes meses. Presila desea realizar labores de deshierbo y fertilización de los cultivos que ha instalado junto a su marido, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Presila es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es bridarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y hacer mejoras en su vivienda que está construida de materiaol rústico.
texts.en:
Presila is 43 years old. A mother of a family, she lives with her husband in the Lives sector, a rural area in the district of Unión Agua Blanca of San Miguel province, in the Cajamarca region. It is located in the mountainous part of the country, four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Since she was very young, Presila has been working in agriculture and cattle farming. She and her husband grow different crops and sell the milk produced by their animals. The income from these activities has supported them since they got married and allowed them to raise their children who are already independent and have formed families of their own. The area where Presila and her husband live is known for the cultivation of various grains and cereals. This season, they have sown corn and peas; they hope that the crops will result in enough income to allow them to make ends meet over the following months. Presila would like weed out and fertilize the crops that she and her husband have sown. This is why she approached Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to seek a loan of 2000 soles. Presila is a very hard-working woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to bring a better quality of life to her family and make improvements to her home, which is currently made from rustic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cultivation of pea and corn crops

location.town: CPM Lives - Unión Agua Blanca - San Miguel - Cajam

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Soy propietario de una tienda de abarrotes, la vida me ha enseñado que no 

hay mejor forma de salir adelante mas que luchando y esforzándose día a día, yo lo hago junto con mi familia 

para tratar de tener mejores condiciones de vida.  

Les solicito apoyo para comprar mercancía y así poder tener mas ventas y por lo tanto mas ganancias
texts.en:
I am the owner of a grocery store. Life has taught me that there's no better way to get ahead than to struggle and push yourself day by day, which I do together with my family in order to try to improve our living situation. I'm asking you for help to be able to buy merchandise, which will help increase sales and, therefore, more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the grocery store

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Esta pequeña pulpería nace con la idea de buscar una forma de generar ingresos a su familia  pero como no tenía mucho dinero decidió buscar la forma en cómo invertir sus ahorros en víveres y venderlos a los vecinos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su tienda, aunque no cuenta con muchos productos ella sigue trabajando para incrementarlos, vende arroz, azúcar y aceite. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar y aceites para su tienda, pues necesario para mantener a sus clientes. El sueño de Maria es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and has been running a general store for more than five years. She began her small business in order to be able to generate some income for her family. She didn't have much money, so she needed a way to invest her money into food products that she could sell to her neighbors. Little by little she improved her store. She continues to work at it, even though she does not have many items. She sells rice, sugar, and cooking oil. She will use the money from this loan to buy more food items for her store, in order to be able to keep her customers. Maria hopes to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
This is Agnes V., a resident of Dasmariñas, Philippines. She is already a widow at 37 and the mother of four children, two of whom are in high school while one is in elementary and the other is staying home. By the grace of God, Agnes has single-handedly managed to support her older children's education up to high school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her two children all the way to college. A dream for most poor Filipino parents like Agnes as she herself has been a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Agnes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 Philippine pesos (PHP)-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Agnes earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling in piece rate. Agnes’ store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 32,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Agnes dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house expanded and renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en: Azucena M. is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family with a hog-fattening business. She lives in Sitio Daan Banwa, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Azucena has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1989 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her hog fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Azucena is borrowing 29,500 PHP so that she can buy an additional hog for future income. This will be her 22nd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Azucena hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal working capital

loans.name: Mente Positivo Group

texts.es:
El comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del sexto ciclo del Programa de comité de Mujeres de Emprendedoras.
Cada una de las integrantes realiza una actividad diferente y todas se están muy contentas con su trabajo ya que mediante el mismo consiguieron ayudar a sus familias.
Así una de las integrantes es la señora Elvira M. quien tiene como actividad principal la atención de su librería  que le genera un ingreso diario.
En su librería ella ofrece útiles escolares como cuaderno, lapices, varios tipos de papeles, carteras escolares, cartucheras y otros.
 Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas útiles escolares para renovar sus mercaderías ademas desea ofrecer nuevas mercaderías como remeras, pantalones, polleras todos para los colegios.
texts.en:
This committee is working on its sixth loan cycle as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. Each member is involved in a different business activity. They are all very happy with their work and hope to continue in the same manner so that they can support their families.

One of the members is Sra. Elvira M.. Her main business activity is managing a bookstore so that she can generate a daily income. At her store she offers school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, different types of paper, school satchels, pouches, and other products.

Elvira is requesting a loan to buy school supplies to revamp her inventory. In addition, she wants to offer new merchandise such as T-shirts, trousers, and skirts that are used for school uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies & uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more pants and quail eggs.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina F. is 51 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a very active woman. Ten years ago, Madina started the business of poultry breeding. She raises the chickens and then sells them at the local market, usually to local restaurants. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children.

Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Madina would like to request a loan to expand her business and increase her family income. She will use the profit generated from the business to repay the loan on time. She is asking for a loan of 600 AZN in order to buy more chickens to sell when they are fully grown.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken

loans.name: Elizabeth   Auma

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. runs ECD Nursury School in Kisumu. She is 32 years old and married to Amos Mbadi, a taxi driver who provides for most of the family's basic needs. Together they are blessed with two children, 11 and 5 years of age.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years and her monthly income is Kshs.22,000. She learned about KADET LTD through their marketing awareness and is now applying for her first loan from KADET microfinance to add more small plastic chairs for children and learning charts for teaching. She intends to utilize the income generated to pay back the loan and expand the classroom. In the future she plans to have a big school that will cater to many pupils.

loans.use: To buy small plastic chairs for pupils and charts for teaching

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in a small city of Pakistan called Vehari, which is famous for its agriculture industry. She is a working woman who sews clothes to supplement the income of her family. She sews clothes as per customer requirement and also gives a good look to the clothes by using colorful laces and designs. Her clients feel happy to be her customer and give her regular orders.
 
Her husband's name is B. A. and he is involved in the animal-selling business. He first buys animals like goats or cows of a young age and keeps them in the house and takes care of them until they've grown up. Then he sells them to animal markets for a good profit. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy animals (goats and cows) of a young age and grow them up for reselling. 

She is hopeful that this investment will bring positive change to her husband’s business and he will be able to make his income double in size. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy animals for reselling

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
María Hilda es una madre de 61 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a mas de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, patos, pollos, palomas y cuyes. Ella cría estos animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia, por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante.

María desea adquirir más animales y alimentos con los cuales alimentarlos. Con esta inversión ella espera aumentar sus ventas, especialmente durante la navidad, que es cuando la demanda aumenta. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y emprendedora. Su anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Hilda is a 61-year-old mother who lives with her family in the village of Muy Finca in the Mochumí district, an agricultural zone that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and located more than forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises small animals to sell such as turkeys, ducks, chickens, pigeons, and guinea pigs.  She raises these animals in the back of her home.  They are naturally grain and grass fed and when they have reached a good level of development, they are offered for sale in the market town of Lambayeque.  This business is an important source of income for her family, so she always tries to do her best to succeed.

María wants to purchase more animals and food to feed them.  With this investment she expects to increase sales, especially at Christmas, when demand increases.  To achieve her objective, she has decided to apply for the first time to Kiva field partner Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 soles.

María is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.  She desires to continue growing as an entrepreneur to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase more animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Honesty Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Honesty Group. They run small scale businesses based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Bai K. who is in the middle. Bai is age 28 and was born in Makeni city. He is single with no children. Bai has been a businessman for two years now. He runs a telephone booth. With his share of this loan, he will buy top-up cards for all four mobile companies, mobile phone accessories, etc., to sell in his telephone booth.

loans.use: To buy top-up cards for all four mobile companies, mobile phone accessories, etc. to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B. is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Tambagan within the municipality of Medina, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Amalia runs a specialized retail store from which she primarily buys and sells coconuts for a copra business in the local community. Amalia has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Amalia successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional coconuts to buy and sell. Amalia is requesting a new loan, her third from HSPFI, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Hope To God Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Hope To God II” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Adama K. is the leader of this group. Adama was born in Gbintin village. She is 29 years old. Adama is married to a businessman and they have three children: two in primary school and one in secondary school. Adama sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), nut oil (lesser in value to palm-oil), garri (fast food made out of cassava roots), etc. With the help of this loan, Adama will buy palm oil, nut oil, garri, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, nut oil, garri, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel T. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Uvurhangai province, central Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is a university student while her youngest daughter works as a private businesswoman. Since 1999, she has been operating a milk, dairy products and grocery trading business in a rented stall at the local market. During the summertime she sells mare's milk (fermented milk) and has become quite experienced in the trade over the many years. She hopes to continue operating her business with stability.  In the future, she dreams of establishing her own dairy product processing factory. Altangerel is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase dairy products and other goods at wholesale prices for her trading business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products and other goods at wholesale prices

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita P. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Warlita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Warlita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like "bibingka" & rice cakes in the local community. Warlita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Warlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Warlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Warlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Warlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bilal

texts.ar:
بلال عمره 24 سنة يعمل سائق عام موظف متزوج وله ولدان له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عائلته كثيرا وهي كل اهتامه 
يسعى دائما الى تعليم اولاده بصورة جيد حتى يكونوا ذات مركز جيد في المجتمع طموح ويحب ان يعلم اولاده يعلم بكد
ونشاط لكي يؤمن القوت اليومي له تاريخ جيد في المجموعة كان يلقى الدعم دائما من عائلته وكان له اثر جيد
على زيادة مدخوله يريد ان يؤسس عمل خاص له كفتح محل جديد للأحذية يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة
الى شراء بضائع جديدة لفتح محل احذية
texts.en: BilA. is 24 years old and married. He has been working as a driver for 15 years. BilA. loves his family and seeks to educate his children well and enhance their sociA. standing. He is ambitious and works diligently to secure his daily income. BilA. has a good history with A. Majmoua. He has the full support of his family. BilA. seeks to establish a private business. He would like to own a shoe store. Through his loan from A. Majmoua, BilA. wants to purchase new merchandise for his store.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise (shoes and bags)

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima lives in a small housing colony in the city of Kamoki which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, which is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for over ten years. She is a housewife and she prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a daughter who is two years old. 

Her husband’s name is A. M. and he operates two businesses. He runs a grocery store in the market through which he offers daily use items to his clients, which include cooking oil, rice, sugar and spices, etc., and he has also put seasonal vegetables outside of his shop to sell to his clients.
 
Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s businesses. With the loan, he will buy groceries and some seasonal vegetables which will help him in increasing his sales and in earning a good income as well. He has been in this business for over ten years, and Saima is hopeful that this investment will be a profitable one for him. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah. She is confident that the loan investment will help her husband in improving his business conditions which will help her family to live a better life. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saima.

loans.use: To buy groceries and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niña, pero desde hace 3 años decidió cultivar de manera independiente junto con su esposo. En la actualidad esta a cargo de sus terrenos y contrata peones para sembrar y cosechar los productos que llevará a vender al mercado central de su ciudad, o como también hay personas que ofrecen comprar todo el terreno ya cultivado, pero depende de Elizabeth cual es mejor opción de elegir siempre y cuando recure la inversión y pueda ganar a la vez. Para el futuro desea tener más terrenos de cultivo y aumentar  la cantidad de semillas a sembrar. Es el crédito número 5  con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas para la próxima siembra de maíz.
