Su mayor anhelo es tener un gran local o una tienda, pero para ello le hace falta de mucho presupuesto para conseguirlo, además la zona en la que ella vive es un poco alejada y no comercial, María sabe que con el tiempo y la ayuda de su familia podrán realizar grandes cosas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, espera poder comprar más mercadería y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children. She has always been a very hardworking woman and for this reason she wants to improve her business. She sells jewelry and hair clips which she makes herself along with the help of her daughter. She has spent 5 years on this activity and until now sales have been good. Her business is set up in a small space inside a friend's shop. This is where she offers pretty assorted jewelry like earrings, rings, bracelets and all kinds of costume jewelry. The advantage of her work is that she can have the time that she needs to be able to care for her children since they require her full attention. Her greatest wish is to have a large store but she lacks the budget to get one. Also, the area in which she lives is a little remote and non-commercial. María knows that with time and the help of her family they can accomplish great things. This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to being very punctual with payments. With the loan that she requests, she hopes to be able to buy more merchandise and thus increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by David Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and increase sales

loans.name: Nyakabare Bakyara Twimukye Group B, Ntungamo

texts.en:
For a time period of ten years, A. David has been running multipurpose businesses that include agriculture and a grocery store in Kabobo cell in Ntungamo. With good management and customer care skills, these businesses generate him a profit of 85,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis.

With hard work, David looks forward to improving his banana plantation through mulching and spraying the pests that are currently disorganizing his crops. This will definitely give his ventures improved conditions for some time.

This loan will contribute to the purchase of pesticides and mulches and also help David to restock his grocery store with more goods that include beans and groundnuts (peanuts).

David’s future plan is to be able to get enough money out of his business to pay his children’s school fees and also to expand his businesses for more income.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and mulches for his plantation and stock for his store

loans.name: Raymundo Ernesto

texts.es: El solicitante es casado tiene una pequeña hija, maneja mototaxi su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su menor hija; tiene un ingreso semanal de S/. 250.00 . El destino del credito es para arreglos en su casa y comprar repuestos de su movilidad
texts.en:
The loan applicant is married with a young daughter. He drives a motorcycle taxi while his wife takes care of their daughter. He has a weekly income of S/. 250.00 [Nuevos Soles]. The loan is to fix up the house and to purchase spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Needs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. makes porridge from rice and serves it at Elmina with bread and groundnut or peanut spread.  Agnes has received a junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a cleaner. She is responsible for helping husband pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more rice and to invest in baking other pastries for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and invest in baking other pastries

loans.name: Delbor

texts.es: Delbor, de 33 años, es un hombre laborioso, que vive con su esposa Cledina de 33 años con quien tiene 2 hijos, todos ellos viven en su domicilio propio, en la localidad de “Patay”. Son más de 13 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa y arveja en terrenos que posee, y con la ayuda su esposa, lo gran producir una buena calidad de estos productos. Generalmente su esposa es la encargada de las labores domésticas, dando además los cuidados adecuados a sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta a Delbor es cultivar papa y ver como florecen, porque es bastante cuidadoso con sus cultivos, pues está seguro que el buen mantenimiento de las tierras es pieza clave para obtener una cosecha exitosa. Por otro lado le incomoda luchar contra las variaciones climáticas, pues el viento y las lluvias son muy fuertes y no dejan que se desarrollo con normalidad. Él, firme continua, pues considera que su trabajo es bastante rentable porque le permite cubrir la educación de sus hijos, cubrir los gastos domiciliarios y ahorrar para  comprar más bienes, para que pueda sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles en un espacio de su casa. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes trabajan de manera activa. Con el crédito, piensa comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Delbor is 33 years old. He is a hardworking man who lives with his wife, Cledina, who is 33 years old and with whom he has 2 children. They all live together in their own house, in the town of Patay. He has been working in agriculture for more than 13 years, planting potatoes and peas on some pieces of land he owns. Generally his wife is in charge of the domestic work and caring for their children. What Delbor likes most is cultivating potatoes and watching them as they grow because he is very careful with his crops; he is certain that taking good care of the land is the key to having successful harvests. On the other hand, he dislikes fighting against the climatic variations. The wind and the rain are very strong and they don’t let the plants develop normally. He is steadfast and continues in his work because he finds his work profitable since it allows him to cover educating his children, the costs of his household, and to save to buy more land so he can plant more. He has also been able to open a small grocery store in his house. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he is happy to continue working with the members of his communal bank, who all work actively. With his loan he plans to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer for his next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S., who is a villager in Si Sla village in Takeo province, was born in 1952. She owns a general store in her village where she sells groceries to earn a good profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mean Un, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to help support his family. 

Since her current business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve her store, Mrs. Chea S. is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to resell. With the rest of the loan she will buy fertilizer, pesticide, and hire a plow machine to plow her field. 

She is the mother of three children, one of whom is attending school, while the others are laborers. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Eliza María

texts.es: La señora Eliza vive en casa propia en la zona de Callampaya de la ciudad de La Paz,  esta separada de su esposo, tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad el cual esta casado por lo tanto la señora Eliza vive sola. La actividad que tiene es la venta de comida en una feria de la ciudad de la paz, donde vende chicharrón y fricasé, con esta actividad ella puede subsistir y también pagar sus estudios. El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos, es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en Impro y forma parte de Kiva.
texts.en:
Eliza lives in her own home in La Paz’s Callampaya neighborhood. She is separated from her husband and has an adult son who is married. Therefore, Eliza lives alone. She sells prepared meals in one of the city of La Paz’s markets; she sells chicharrón y fricasé (fried pork rinds and spicy pork stew). This activity helps her support herself and pay for her schooling. The requested loan will be used to buy ingredients. This is the first time she’s gotten a loan from Impro and been a part of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Dalmita Irene

texts.es:
Dalmita de 49 años, vende productos naturales y vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Ella comenzó cosiendo ropa cuando llego a vivir en ese sector pero como necesitaba mas ingresos ya que es madre soltera decidió comprar  productos naturales a base de noni, calcio y frutos y los comenzó a vender a sus amigos y conocidos. Ahora ella tiene un pequeño local de nutrición y venta de productos naturales.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas productos a base de noni, calcio y frutas. En el futuro quiere ser distribuidora al por mayor de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Dalmita, 49, sells natural products. She lives in a periurban area called “Duran” that is noted for its deteriorating ecology. She started sewing clothes when she first moved to this sector but, being a single mother and needing higher income, she decided to buy natural products based on Noni, calcium and fruits and started to sell them to friends and acquaintances. She now has a small nutrition bar and sells natural products. She will use the loan to buy more Noni, calcium and fruits based products. In the future she wants to be a wholesale distributor of natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For Noni and fruit based natural products.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley Q. is 44 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. She is from the village of Lower Lilingayon within Valencia City, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Shirley runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and other products as well as a variety of viands for meals to the local community. She also buys and sells bananas. Shirley has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Shirley joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta P. is from the village of Puerta, Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 44 years-old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Vicenta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste as well as biscuits and junk food in the local community. Vicenta has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vicenta joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Vicenta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en: Marylou C. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marylou owns and operates a specialized retail store buying sacks of rice and selling it per kilogram in the local community. Marylou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Marylou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marylou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marylou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Waldir

texts.es:
El   Sr. Waldir   es casado tiene   2  hijos,  todos   en edad escolar.
El   se dedica a la venta de Zapatos Usados,  en su domicilio, cuya venta le genera  un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
Hoy día el es una microempresario exitoso con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de calzados.
texts.en:
Sr. Waldir is married and has 2 school-aged children.  He operates a business in his house, selling used shoes.  The business provides him with a good income.

Waldir is managing to forge ahead with help from his wife and much sacrifice and dedication.  He is now a successful micro-entreprenuer who, thanks to the good deals he offers, has a large customer base.  He has shown himself to be honest and responsible in his dealings and he is applying for this loan to stock his business.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Bernadette's Group

texts.en:
Bernadette B. is from the village of Pulay, Luna Isabela. She is 42 years old. Bernadette is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Bernadette is married and has two school age children. To make a living, Bernadette owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Bernadette has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bernadette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Bernadette is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Bernadette from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Maura raises crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maura wants to have a stable income and so she works hard.

Maura joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. Maura plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm inputs

loans.name: Amelia Ninfa

texts.es:
Amelia Ninfa S. R. tiene 50 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre junto a su compañero y sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.


Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Amelia Ninfa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  mejorar la calidad de vida y ampliar el negocio.

Le gusta cocinar y compartir momentos con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amelia Ninfa S. R. is 50 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 6 children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Amelia Ninfa is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  She buys her products in Mata de Cacao and makes her sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

Amelia Ninfa a is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her rice, banana, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to improve her quality of life and to expand her business.

Amelia Ninfa likes cooking and spending time with her children.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 47 years old. Minda is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Minda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, & toothpaste in the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Minda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Minda is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Minda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods

loans.name: Ada Antonieta

texts.es:
Doña Ada, tiene 54 años D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel, en este lugar vive con sus dos hijos D. 21 y 17 años D. edad, ambos estudian, y dependen económicamente D. ella, doña Ada se dedica a un taller D. costura, comenzó este oficio luego D. que aprendiera en una academia, eso hace 21 años, trabaja D. 7:30 am a 8:00pm, este horario depenD. D. la cantidad D. trabajos pendientes que tenga.
Por el momento ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. telas para la época escolar, y pagar el mantenimiento D. 4 maquinas D. coser que tiene en el taller, con esta ayuda podrá mantener a disposición D. los clientes diferentes clases y colores D. telas para uniformes escolares así como para trajes formales. 
Su objetivo es mantenerse activa, con un taller fortalecido y estable, en buenas condiciones, crecer en personal D. apoyo y velar por los interese del hogar, también por el estudio D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ada is 54 years old and she lives in San Miguel. She lives with her two children, 21 and 17 years of age. They are both in school and are financially dependent on her. Ada has a sewing shop. She started the business following some training she took at an academy 21 years ago. She works from 7:30 am to 8pm. Her work schedule depends on the number of orders she has outstanding. 

She requests a loan to purchase fabrics to get ready for the back to school season, and to pay for maintenance repairs to 4 sewing machines she has in her shop. These improvements will help her proviD. her clients with a variety of colors and types of fabrics for school uniforms and formal wear. 

Her goal is to keep active with a strong and stable shop, and to increase the support staff. She endeavors to proviD. for the wellbeing of the home and to support her children in her studies.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics in various colors.

loans.name: Vey

texts.en: Vey M. is a 21-year-old married woman who resides in the province of Kompong Chhnang. Vey M. was married for a few years but she doesn’t have a child yet. Vey M. currently owns a small business. She makes iron pots at home and then sells to her finish product to her regular customer who comes directly to her house. Vey M. earns around $2.50 per day from her business. She has a life partner in her husband who earns an income by selling sand. He uses a machine to pump sand from the river in and around his village. Unfortunately, an existing machine is broken down while using process. Therefore, Vey M. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL for her husband

loans.use: To purchase a new machine to change the broken one.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: La Señora Irene es originaria de la localidad del ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, ella tiene 58 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el quinto año de primaria y dice que no pudo terminar sus estudios porque sus papas no quisieron que siguiera estudiando por falta de recursos económicos por que eran muchos hermanos y nos les alcanzaba para comprarles las libretas, está casada con el señor Pedro quien se dedica a la albañilería, ellos procrearon 7 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ellos Guadalupe de 21 años y Tomasa de 12 años quien estudia la secundaria. Doña Irene tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y se dedica a vender flores de ornato, aguacates y chiles manzanos ya que tiene una huerta y un vivero, ella sale a venderlos por botes a la central de abastos en la ciudad de Zitacuaro y que casi todo lo que vende son pedidos que tiene con sus clientes. La señora Irene está pidiendo su préstamo a Fundación Realidad para comprar huevo, azúcar, sopas, frijol y otros productos más de primera necesidad. Comenta que antes ella se dedicaba a vender frutas y legumbres de temporada en los tianguis de la región y que por cuestiones de salud decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa ya que está enferma de la espalda y los huesos por el esfuerzo que hacia al cargar botes muy pesados. Dice va a beneficiar el préstamo a sus clientes y a ella porque ya no se irán a otras tiendas mas retiradas y que encontraran en su tienda lo que necesiten para sus necesidades en su hogar, también ella podrá vender sus aguacates y los chiles manzanos que tiene en su casa. Sus metas es ampliar su huerta de aguacates y chiles manzanos, también surtir su tienda de abarrotes y meter productos de mercería para que las clientas de su localidad no se trasladen a la ciudad de Zitacuaro y no hagan gastos de traslado. Doña Irene confía que le ira muy bien en su tienda de abarrotes y en la venta de los aguacates y chiles manzanos ya que se esta aclientando en su localidad, comenta que con las ganancias que saque pintara su casa y la remodelara.
texts.en: Irene is a native of the state of Michoacán. She is 58 years old and has a fifth-grade education. She says she stopped going to school because her parents didn't want her to continue her education due to a lack of financial resources because she had many siblings and they couldn't afford to buy books. Irene is married to Pedro, who makes a living as a construction worker. They have seven children, of which two live with them: Guadalupe, 21, and Tomasa, 12, who is in school. Irene runs a convenience store out of her home and makes a living selling ornamental flowers, avocados and chili peppers, since she has a garden and a nursery. She goes out on boats to sell them to suppliers in the city of Zitacuaro, and almost always what she sells is on order from customers. Irene is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Fundación Realidad to purchase eggs, sugar, soups, beans and other products of more primary need. She says that previously she made a living on selling seasonal fruits and legumes in the regional street markets but for health reasons she decided to open a store out of her home since her back and bones ached out of the effort from loading the very heavy cargo into the boats. She says that she and her clients are going to benefit from the loan because they won't go to other, more remote stores and will be able to find everything they need in her store. Irene will also be able to sell her avocados and chili peppers out of her home. Her goal is to expand her garden of avocados and chili peppers and also stock her store with products so that her local customers don't have to travel to Zitacuaro or have travel expenses. Irene says that her store is going very well and that her avocado and chili pepper sales are gaining customers in her area. She says with the earnings she makes she will paint and remodel her home.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to stock her store

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 49 years old and is married with three children. Jacqueline earns a living by sewing different styles of clothes. This is her 15th successful year in this business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 8am until 7pm every day.

Jacqueline needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more cloth for sewing. By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, Jacqueline hopes to earn more profits, and she will save for her future. Thus, she will create another job for the people in her community.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for sewing

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.ru: Нажмиддин Хакими проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 43 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын находится в России. Сам Нажмиддин зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Najmiddin H. lives in J.Rumy. He is 43 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. His son is in Russia. Najmiddin makes a living by raising cattle. He is raising cattle for sale in the future. He has been doing this work for four years.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita S. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Pacita is single and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling snack foods, biscuits, instant noodles and beverages. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Pacita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Pacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rahab Muthoni

texts.en:
Rahab has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last four years.  She is 45 years old.  She is married to Gabriel N. and they have two children.  

Rahab was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy a cow and seeds, and pay for labor.  In the future, Rahab hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a cow, seeds, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Inn

texts.en:
Inn, 63, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Inn and his wife are farmers, earning an income of $3.55 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $16 on the other necessary expenses. 

Inn is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Ly Nhan-1-6 Group

texts.en:
Huong was born in 1982. She lives in Ly Nhan village, Duc Tu commune. She is married with 2 children. Her husband is a truck driver and has a monthly income of about 4,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND).

Miss Huong has a restaurant. She sells beer, fruit, etc. She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and repaid loans punctually. She is the group leader of a 5-member loan group.She wants to borrow  5,014,000 Vietnamdong (VND) to invest in her restaurant.

About the other borrowers in her group:
 Doanh is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 Nhien is 49 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise pigs.
 Dung is 24 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her business.
 Phuoc is 31 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.use: to invest in her restaurant

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her dream is to establish a cereal shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase three bags of beans, chicks and poultry feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase three bags of beans, chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is single and has one child not yet in school. Yasin has a business of a stationary shop that sells exercise books and the use of a printing machine, which he has had for two years. He also has a second business of a small shop that sells produce like maize.  

To help expand his business, Yasin has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more printing paper, and exercise books for sale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yasin hopes to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. In the future, Yasin hopes to own a factory that makes printing paper.

loans.use: to purchase more printing paper and exercise books to sell.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 4 Group

texts.fr: JESUTOGBE 4 est un groupe de huit personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Emilienne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Barnabé. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux à leur charge. Emilienne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Emilienne n'est jamais allé à l'école.  Il y a une trentaine d'année que Emilienne vend des produits vivriers et aussi des poissons frais à son domicile. Emilienne exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Emilienne s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Emilienne sollicite une autre crédit avec les membres du groupe JESUTOGBE 4. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The Jesutogbe 4 group comprises eight people who all live in the same area in Benin. The group leader, Emilienne (with the raised hand in the photo), is 46 years old and married to a fisherman named Barnabé. The couple have four children, all of whom are in school and two of whom are in the care of their parents. Emilienne and her husband live together with their children and take care of the various needs of the children. Emilienne never attended school. For about thirty years, she has sold food items as well as fresh fish at her home. Emilienne runs this business passionately, and it allows her to provide for herself and her children. She gets her supplies in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele, Emilienne is seeking another loan along with the rest of the members of the Jesutogbe 4 group. This loan will allow them to strengthen their working capital in order to better respond to the needs of their clientele and generate higher profits.

loans.use: To buy various food items and fresh fish.

loans.name: Victor Ausberto

texts.es:
Víctor de 59 años de edad, es soltero, vive su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.  

Víctor se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras en un puesto en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con una experiencia de 3 años , es por eso que es conocida y tiene su propia clientela,  las ventas de sus productos se han ido incrementando; al igual que sus ingresos para sus necesidades diarias de su casa y personales.  También cría y comercializa aves de corral para poder tener otro ingreso económico.

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue de 1000 nuevos soles, servirá para comprar más frutas y verduras para abastecer su puesto en el mercado, con el fin de satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y también para adquirir alimentos para sus aves de corral, el aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito y cumplir con sus obligaciones de su casa donde vive.  Víctor es una persona con muchos aspiraciones y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener otro  puesto en el mercado y contar con más comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Victor, 59, is single.  He lives in a house, in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque, that has electricity and running water.  Lambayeque is a rural area and the people there work at farming, livestock-rearing and tourism.

Victor has owned a fruit and vegetable business for 3 years.  He operates the business in a stall at a local market.  He's well-known and has a regular set of customer.  His sales have increased steadily and, in turn, his income.  He also operates a poultry business, another source of income for him.

He applied to an Edpyme Alternativa partner, Capital Semilla, for a 1000 new soles loan.  He will use part of the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock his market business, something he needs to meet demand from his customers.  He will use another part of the loan to buy feed for his poultry business.  He will use the extra income from the investments to repay the loan and cover household expenses.  Victor is an ambitious man and one of his goals is to open another market stall so that he can go on improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Seim

texts.en:
Seim, 41, is working in massage shop. Her husband is working in the Ministry of Environment, their income is $10 per day. She has three children, two are studying and one is working in a hotel making $2.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work. She wants to buy grocery goods for her daughter to sell at home after she finishes secondary school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son's commute to work

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones,polos,blusas,chompas entre otras ropas, la socia vende ropa para varones,mujeres y niños, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor como pantalones, polos, blusas y chompas. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Jose Carlos Mariategui” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, widowed, and has four children. Rosa divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling clothes. She sells trousers, polo shirts, blouses, sweaters, and other types of clothing. Rosa sells clothes for men, women, and children. She works from 7am to 6pm and sells her goods at the market in Urubamba. Through her business, Rosa is able to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand her business of selling clothes, so she is requesting a loan to buy clothing in bulk such as trousers, polo shirts, blouses, and sweaters.

Rosa is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk such as trousers, polo shirts, blouses, and sweaters.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: Dentro de algunos años José Manuel se ve dirigiendo la contabilidad de una empresa de prestigio. Realizar su sueño de tener una vida mejor con mejor salario, apoyar a su familia; sin éste conocimiento me sería imposible realizarlo. Le inspira su familia ya que son la base de su vida, quiere herederar un buen ejemplo para sus hijos. La carga laboral es un desafío que tiene que enfrentar ya que cuenta con poco tiempo para estudiar. Trata de laborar más horas diarias para tener los sábado libres.
texts.en: In a few years José Manuel will be an accountant for a prestigious company. "Without this job I would not be able to make my dream come true of having a better life and better salary to support my family." His family inspires him since they are the foundation to his life. He wants to be a good example for his children. Work labor is an obstacle he has to face since he has little time to study. He tries to work more during the weekdays to have Saturdays free.

loans.use: get an Accounting Degree.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: La señora Santa cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años ofreciendo buena calidad y servicio a sus clientes. Para Santa este negocio es medio de distracción y a la vez una fuente de ingresos, en la cual se desempeña como una buena negociante. Como ya se viene la temporada de frio, la gente le solicita ropa de invierno, por eso solicita del apoyo para comprar ropa de temporada como suéter, pantalones, pantaloneras, chamarras, camisas y más, de esta manera las ventas incrementaran y sus ingresos serán mayores para el sostén familiar.
texts.en:
Sra. Santa has a business of selling used clothing. For the past four years, she has been offering good quality and service to her customers. This business provides a means of distraction for Santa, as well as a source of income. It has also taught her how to be a good businesswoman. Since cooler weather is approaching, people are asking for winter clothes.

For this reason, Santa is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothing such as sweaters, pants, trousers, jackets, shirts, and other items so that she can increase her sales. As a result, her income will improve so that she can sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Yaner

texts.es: Yaner, tiene la edad 41 de años, está casado y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos para la asistencia de sus siembras. El comprara los abonos, y los atomizadores para su mantenimiento sano. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo y se encuentra en crecimiento por lo cual necesita darle la mayor asistencia para salir adelante con el proyecto y obtener buenas cosechas. El pretende obtener la mayor de las ganancias para así brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejor bienestar económico. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yaner is 41 years old and is married and living with his wife and 2 children. He hopes to buy inputs to assist with his planting. He will buy fertilizers and  sprays for healthy maintenance.  

He counts on the land to be suitable for cultivation of the crop.  He finds in growing what is needed it allows him to advance with the project and obtain good harvest. He hopes to obtain greater earnings to provide his family a better quality of life and better economic well being. 

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with greater facilities and low interest rates.

loans.use: to assist with his tomato and chili plants.

loans.name: Rodrigues

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos ainda bebés. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os seus irmãos enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas. 

Saiu da sua terra natal a procura de emprego, é serralheiro ha mais de 13 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 11.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar ferro para a sua serralharia. O primeiro emprestimo foi de:7.000.00mt para A MESMA ACTIVIDADE.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para fazer crescer o seu negocio e abrir uma oficina, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique. He is married and has two infant children. He completed 3rd grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns. He also supports his siblings by sending money to help with their expenses.
He left his homeland in search of a job. He has been a locksmith for over 13 years and earns an income of about 5.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 11.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase iron for his locksmith business. The first loan was for 7.000mt for the same business.
He intends to request more money in order to expand his business and open up a shop. He will request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase iron for his locksmith business.

loans.name: Sharshenbu's Group

texts.en:
Sharshenbu is the leader of this group. She is 60 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised a son and a daughter. The daughter is employed and the son studies at school.

Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, the family bought two farm animals for breeding. Reselling the livestock after fattening, Sharshenbu earns about 5,000 soms per month. With money from the loan, she wants to increase the number of livestock.

In the near future, with the profits gained from reselling animals, she plans to purchase household appliances to improve the family’s living conditions. 

======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit:  www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at  www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Vanh

texts.en: Vanh, 24, is a single woman who lives with her mother in Siem Reap province. Vanh earns a living by giving people massages in her workplace near the province's market. She has been engaged in this business since 2009 and she is able to generate approximately $4.00 per day from her business activity. Her workplace is far away from her house, so every day she takes a motorcycle taxi to work, which makes her spend a fortune per month. Vanh wants to use the amount of $500 to buy a second-hand motorcycle. This loan will help her reduce some of her expenses and save more money for her future business growth.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Justina Zoraida

texts.es:
Justina de 39 años, decidió dedicar a la activada de vender producto para uso personal como perfume, maquillaje, etc., por recomendación de una amiga.

Justina sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos a amigos y familiares de 8 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.
La única dificultad de su trabajo es la delincuencia debido a que recorre sectores muy peligrosos constantemente.

No esta casada y tiene 4 hijos de 15, 11, 6 y 5 años estudian en escuela fiscal.
Su meta es poder prepararse para ser consultora así poder inscribir a personas para poder poner una oficina de ventas de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Justina, 39 years old, decided to sell products for personal use like perfume, makeup etc. for a living, by recommendation of a friend.

Justina goes out every day to offer her products to friends and family from 8 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon.
The only difficulty of her job is the crime because she constantly travels very dangerous neighborhoods.

She is not married and has 4 children ages 15, 11, 6 and 5. They attend public school. Her goal is to be able to prepare herself to be a consultant so she can enroll people in order to start a cosmetic sales office.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: For the last seven years, Monica has earned a living as a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru.  She is 23 years old, married and has one child, who is currently enrolled in school. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our clients and is applying her first loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and seeds as well as hire a worker to help her on her farm. In the future, Monica hopes to improve her skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nyandeng

texts.en: Nyandeng is 37 years old and married with three children. One of the children is in school. Nyandeng has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for 2 years. Nyandeng is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 32 years old.  She has three children and two of them go to school.  Patricie sells different merchandise in her store for which she has been running for the past 10 years.  She needs this loan to buy more items such as rice, soap, and sugar.  She will use the profits to save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soap, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Fatou Seck

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou est une jeune dame de 36 ans, mariée qui exerce le commerce depuis  onze ans .Son activité consiste à vendre des vaisselles et divers  autres marchandises
Avec  ce prêt, elle va acheter de la vaisselle pour revendre  
Elle n’a pas de charges ce qui lui permettra de refinancer  son bénéfice dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Madame Fatou is 36 years old, married, and has been in business for 11 years.  She sells tableware and various other products. 
With this loan, she will purchase tableware to sell.  
She does not have anybody in her care, which will allow her to reinvest her earnings in her business.

loans.use: to buy tableware to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa sells groceries in Asebu Brebia. She is married and has 8 dependents. Her husband is a carpenter. Adwowa has been in this business for the past 8 years. With her income, she assists her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Adwowa will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. She hopes to expand her grocery business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Cristian Jairo

texts.es:
Cristian tiene 33 años, vive al lado de su esposa y juntos son padres de un pequeña de un añito a quien quieren mucho y sobre todo luchan cada día para poder darle una vida digna y sobre todo llena de amor y ejemplo de lucha. Cuando Cristian tiene un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con su familia y en ocasiones jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio y le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Cuy Chactado”.
Día a día Cristian trabaja como operario de Hornos en una panadería, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su familia; él  cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es my responsable y sobre todo cuidadoso con su trabajo.

Cristian está muy a gradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como colocación de pisos, refacción de paredes, entre otros, de esta manera podrá ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder brindarle más seguridad a su familia”.
texts.en:
Cristian is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and together they are parents of a small one year old girl who they love very much and above all strive every day to be able to give her a decent life, above all full of love and examples of striving. When Cristian has spare time he likes to go out and walk with his family and on occasions play soccer with his friends and neighbors from his neighborhood. He likes to enjoy one of his favorite dishes which is the delicious Cuy Chactado [fried guinea pig]. Day to day Cristian works as an oven operator in a bakery. He works around 8 hours per day and with the fruits of his labor can settle with much effort the expenses of his family. He believes that he is doing well in his work because he is very responsible and above all careful in his work.

Cristian is very grateful for the Kiva loans since thanks to the help they have offered him he will be able to make improvements in his housing such as placing the flooring and repairing the walls, among other things. In this manner he will be able to offer a better quality of life to his family and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: "To give a good education to his child and to be able to offer more security to his family."

loans.use: to improve his housing: placement of flooring, repairing of walls, among other things.

loans.name: Hare

texts.en: Hare is a married man. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be breakdown of motorcycle. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have more motorcycles within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Chat

texts.en:
S. Chat is 34 year old wife and mother of two daughters. Her oldest daughter attends school, and her younger one stays home. She and her husband run a shop where they resell a wide range of plastic spare parts. They earn about $7.50 a day from this business. 

They are confident that S. Chat could run this business on her own, and would like for her husband to earn additional income through other employment. They are requesting this loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike so that he can be a motorbike taxi driver. This would allow them to increase their income and standard of living. 

This is S. Chat\'s 4th loan with CREDIT and she does not think she will have any trouble repaying it. In the future she would like to expand her spare parts business, and earn enough money to send her younger daughter to school.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike

loans.name: Holger

texts.en:
Holger has a small shop where he offers food staples. He started this business with the help of his wife, who had been helping her parents with their business for ten years. At first they only sold sweets and home cleaning products. Now they also sell groceries and sausages.

Holger aspires to sell baby products and office supplies. He will use this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale prices. He has faith that with these new products his business will grow and his economic stability will improve.

Holger is married and he has two children. He is 36 years old. He is originally from Manabí, and he moved to Guayaquil to find a better life for his family. He depends entirely on this business for the education and support of his children. Holger is sure that this loan will give him security and will allow him to save for the future.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Holger tiene una tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa quien había ayudado a sus padres en un negocio en el mercado trabajando con ellos diez años. Al principio solo vendía confitería y productos de limpieza para el hogar. Ahora continua vendiendo este producto junto con víveres y embutidos.

Holger aspira vender producto para bebes y artículos de oficina. El usara el préstamo para invertir en compra de artículos de bazar a precios de mayoristas.El tiene la fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá y su estabilidad económica mejorara.

Holger esta casado y tiene dos hijos. Tiene 36 años es oriundo de Manabí se mudo a Guayaquil para encontrar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. El depende de su negocio completamente para la educación y sustento de sus hijos. Holger esta seguro que este préstamo le dará seguridad y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Holger aspira vender  producto para bebes y artículos de oficina

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.en: Hola mi nombre es Brenda Patricia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación,  el que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos familiares y lo mas importante es que puedo atender a mis hijos, cosa que no podria hacer   si trabajara  en otro lugar, actualmente el volumen de ventas es mayor por lo que necesito surtir mas mi negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes, logrando asi mayores ventas y de esa forma mejorar los ingresos y el nivlel de vida de mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de manteca, frijoles, arroz, manteca, lacteos, azucar, jabon, pollo, harina y dulces.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham K. owns and operates a market in the town of Devechi, which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Ilham wants to invest in his business so that he can increase the number of customers that come to his store.

loans.use: To invest in his business to increase his customer base

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a 25 years old woman who is married with no children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned her business for two years before she started her own business in the year 2003. She sells weavons, relaxers, drinks, and recharge cards. According to her, the loan of $250 will boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, relaxers, drinks, and recharge cards

loans.name: Nasraddin

texts.en: Nasraddin (his sister is pictured) is 47 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his family in the Khachmaz region, in the Ashagi-Zeyid village. He and his sister need a loan of $825 to buy fruit seedlings and  fertilizer for improving their orchard. They have run this business for four years.

loans.use: To buy fruit seedlings and  fertilizer

loans.name: Alternativa 8 Group

texts.es:
Pascuala, just like the other members of the group, works as a local artisan creating tablecloths, seat cushions, and napkins which she knits with beautiful local designs. These are the local designs of the area. Pascuala also has a small business in her house in which she sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her community. The rest of the ladies in the group sell their jewelry to the local stores and among tourists that visit the area.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

PASCUALA AL IGUAL QUE LA OTRAS INTEGRANTES DE SU GRUPO TRABAJA COMO ARTESANA CONFECCIONANDO MANTELES , COJINES, SERVILLETAS Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA CON LOS DISEÑOS TIPICOS QUE CARACTERIZAN LOS BORDADOS DE LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE .ADEMAS PASCUALA TIENE UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EN SUS CASDA DONDE VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS A LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD . EL RESTO DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO COMERCIALIZAN SUS PRENDAS ARTESANALES ENTRE LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA

loans.use: Purchase of  knitting materials for wholesale and materials to make their own jewelry

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia I. is 70 years old and married with 9 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more goats for sale. She has been in business since1987.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale

loans.name: Kit

texts.en: Mrs. Kit V., 52, is married with 5 children and works as a farmer making on average about $3.50 a day of profit. Her husband, Mr. Ka Sa, 54, owns a plot of land growing a variety of vegetables and normally earns around $2 a day. This couple has five children. Two are car mechanics earning around $200 a month and three others are students. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a plot of land to grow some vegetables in order to gain more profit. In the future, this couple plans to open a garage for their son.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a plot of land to grow more vegetables.

loans.name: Budumuli East A E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose B.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and add more stock. Rose is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 2 children aged 10 and 14, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save and also pay the school fees for her children. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to buy a public pay phone and more stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Ruth N. and Aida N.. Ruth N. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy another sewing machine. Aida N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to stock more clothes.

loans.use: To add capital to retail shop and boost it

loans.name: Munevera

texts.en:
Munevera is a 31-year-old woman from Babići, a small village near the town Gračanica. She is married and she has two children, ages 7 and 10 years old, who go to primary school.

This is her third loan from MCO WWI (Women for Women International). The first loan was for 5 000 KM, the second loan was for 1000 KM and this loan is for 500 KM. Munevera is taking this loan to buy food for her livestock. Her wish is to expand her livestock business.

loans.use: To buy food for livestock.

loans.name: Kisumu Ndogo Upendo Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Millicent A. is a mother aged 43 with 3 children. She lives with 1 orphan child of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Millicent started her shoes business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local hospital located in Eldoret town. She currently deals in ladies’ shoes but would like to diversify to children’s and men’s collections as well. As she is the bread winner for the family, it would enable her to support both her children and her husband, whose job is low-paying.

With the little profit that she gets from the business, Millicent still struggles to pay her house rent and to feed and clothe her children. But with the help of her loan, Millicent will be able to add more stock and increase her monthly sales.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand shoes in bulk

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco works as the technical director of the Club Bolivar’s football schools and he is responsible for his two children. He lives in the area of Miraflores in the city of La Paz. This is the second time he requests a loan with Impro, and it will be spent on a costly medical treatment for his son who has started suffering from anaemia and he does not have sufficient resources for the treatment. His work and responsibility give him the opportunity of obtaining this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco trabaja como director técnico en las escuelas de futbol que tiene el Club Bolívar, tiene dos hijos que están a su cargo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el mismo que será destinado para el tratamiento medico de su hijo ya que está con principios de anemia y necesita una gran colaboración y no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para ese tratamiento. Su trabajo y responsabilidad le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.

loans.use: Costs related to medical treatment for his anaemic son.

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en:
Tautala S., 41, is married with 4 children. She has 10 years of experience in the fishing business. She sells fish in the village and to the general public 5 days per week. Her husband helps her with the business.

Tautala has never had a loan through SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD). SPBD loans are Tautala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Born

texts.en:
Born S., 50, is a widow and earns approximately US$ 6 in profit per day from selling groceries in front of her house. She has six children, three of whom are employed as garment factory workers with a salary of US$ 70 each per month. The others are students and help their mother with housework and selling products.

Born has requested a loan from Kiva to add grocery inventory to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory to meet her customer demand

loans.name: Hila Patricia

texts.es:
Hilda es casada y tiene 3 hijos: Sergio de 8 años, Adriana de 6 años  y Mia de 2 años. Ella quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos escolares de sus hijos ya que desean darles una buena educación para que puedan salir adelante en un futuro; por lo que hace 2 años inicio con la venta de zapatos por catalogo, y tambien otros articulos, y ha obtenido buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para tener mas surtido de mercancía y poder darles mejor servicio a sus clientes entregándoles mas rápido la mercancía.
texts.en:
Hilda is married and has three children: Sergio (8 years old), Adriana (6 years old) and Mia (2 years old). She wanted to help her husband cover the cost of sending their children to school -- to give them a good education so they can get ahead in the future. Two years ago Hilda began selling shoes from a catalogue, as well as other goods, and has made good profits. Hilda needs a loan for $250 -- which she will pay back in 4 months -- to increase her stock of merchandise. This will help her offer better service to her clients by delivering their orders in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima M. was born in 1949 and comes from Derventa. She is married and her husband is in retail. Fatima is an owner of a local store, and her husband works with her part time. Fatima takes care of everything and the business in the store is good. She is is satisfied because she doesn`t expect too much. She hopes to earn, every day, enough for their costs. She is taking a loan through WWI to provide bigger offerings in her store and to keep selling on this level.

loans.use: To buy products for reselling

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: Sharofat is the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a simple worker and doesn’t earn much. So to help her husband she started cooking cakes and selling them at the markets. Her cakes were so tasty that clients started to order cakes right in her house. Now since she has many regular clients she wants to buy good cooking equipment and thus produce more cakes.

loans.use: Purchasing cooking equipment.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio tiene 40 años, está separado de su pareja, vive con su único hijo mayor de edad. Es agricultor, se dedica al cultivo de  café, actividad que  viene realizando por  30 años, además es una actividad que le agrada hacer  porque le gusta vivir  junto a la naturaleza, y disfrutar del fruto de su trabajo al ver sus plantaciones de café, producto que por cierto es muy rentable,  por la gran demanda  y el costo  alto que tiene de  venta. Sin embargo, lo difícil es cultivar, estos productos deben llevar un adecuado procedimiento, hasta tener el producto terminado. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Lucio  invertirá en la compra de  plantas de café para aumentar sus  hectáreas de terrenos.
texts.en:
Lucio is 40 years old, is separated from his partner and lives with his only son, who is grown up. He is a farmer and works cultivating coffee, an activity he has practiced for 30 years. He enjoys his work because he likes living close to nature and seeing the fruits of his labor in his coffee plantation. Coffee is a very profitable crop thanks to strong demand and a high sale price. Nevertheless, the challenge is in the cultivation, these crops need to have an adequate development through to harvest. This is Lucio's first loan with MFP. He will invest in the purchase of coffee plants to increase the hectares of his terrain.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee plants to increase his production

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im S. is 62 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She runs a small laundry in her house to provide her services by washing clothes for her customers, for which she can receive $0.50 a set. She started the business in 1995. She is married to Soam Lo, 72, who also works with her. She has three children, all of whom are married and are employed: the eldest son is a soldier, the second son is construction worker, and the last son helps his mother to wash clothes. To make the family healthy, S. would like to apply for a loan to build a bathroom. The bathroom is a very important place for good hygiene.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Balongi Group

texts.en:
Thérèse is 30 years old and single. She lost her mother in 1991 and her father in 1997. After her parents passed away, no one could help her come out of the horrible economic situation she was experiencing without her family. Thérèse had to quit her studies and start a business. With just $100 in starting capital, she began selling canned goods, such as canned tomatoes, margarine, corned beef, milk, and sardines in 2004. With hard work and good management, she succeeded in stabilizing her business.

In November 2006, Thérèse heard an announcement at her church about Hope’s microfinance program, and she decided to join the community bank, Balongi. She has been a faithful client of Hope, receiving six loans that she regularly and completely paid back. Thérèse is now happy because she has taken control of her financial life.

loans.use: To diversify her business by adding clothing

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria de la Concepción C. tiene la edad de 42 años habita en el barrio los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el trabaja como ebanista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo un hijo  el cual le apoya con el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, doña Maria desde hace veinte años trabaja sus tierras y comercializa sus cultivos, ella esta muy contenta con el apoyo que le brindamos ya que ha podido establecer mas cultivos y ha mejorado las condiciones de la piña. Con esta solicitud va a comprar insumos agrícolas para los cultivos para tener una mejor cosecha y vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepción C. is 42 years old and lives in the Ríos neighborhood of Ticuantepe with her husband, who works as a cabinetmaker to support her with the household expenses. They have a son who they support through their crops. For 20 years Maria has worked her land and sold her crops. She is very happy with the support we provide to her as she has been able to grow more crops and improve the condition of her pineapple crop. With this loan she will buy agricultural consumables for her crops in order to have a better harvest and sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural consumables for her crops

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi is a soap seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Kutoa Ni Moyo group (Group code 2045). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$50. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mkasi is 30 years old, married, and has two children: ages 5 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi A. is forty-three years old. He is a married man and has two children, both girls. Both of his daughters are in the basic school. He says that, as the man of the house, he needs to work very hard to make income to support the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Kofi’s wife is a trader. She runs a cold store in the local market to support him financially.

Kofi deals in second-hand textiles and unisex clothes. He buys bales of second-hand clothes from Kumasi and treks to sell in markets in the nearby communities. He has been in business for three years. Kofi wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles. He is hopeful to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy second-hand textiles and clothing

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира – женщина 40 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Фаровон г. Гафурова. Её муж работает подсобником мастера отделки и ремонта квартир. В зимнее время такого вида работы очень мало. Но летом он будет зарабатывать лучше. Замира тоже старается вложить свою долю в бюджет семьи и повысить уровень жизни своей семьи. Замира закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Цель ее займа является расширение ассортимента ее товара. Она очень надеется что кредитование поможет для достижения ее цели.
texts.en:
Zamira is a 40 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 2 children. Zamira sells children’s clothing at the Farovon market in Gafurov. Her husband works as an assistant to a contractor who finishes and repairs apartments. In the winter there are very few jobs like this, but in the summer he will have better earnings. Zamira also tries to contribute her share to the family budget and to increase the quality of life for her family. She purchases products at the wholesale market in Istarashvan. The goal of her loan is to increase her product assortment. She has high hopes that the loan will help her to reach her goal.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: Leonisa C. is fifty-eight years old and lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur.  Her husband, Jesus C., works on the farm, but the income from their farm is not enough for their daily needs.  She started a sari-sari store so that she can generate income to help provide for their daily needs.  She realizes how helpful the profits generated from the sari-sari store are.  She decided to apply to one of Kiva's field partners, Paglaum Coop, for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This is her second loan cycle, payable in six months, and is for purchasing more stock requested by her customers.  Because of the progress of her sari-sari she plans to renovate the store and add a video player to attract more customers.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has been operating a general store and a hog-raising business for many years. She is hoping that her request for a loan of PHP 15,000 will be granted so she can buy more inventory for her store. The income from her business greatly assists her in providing education for her children. She hopes that all her businesses will become sustainable in the future, so the family can have a progressive and comfortable way of life. She works hard so that she can help her husband to meet the needs of their family.
